column1: good length, 81mph, wide of off, Harris leaves comfortably. Not much shape or nip first ball
81mph, huge appeal for LBW angled in and it comes off pad and runs fine for a leg bye. No review from England. It was going down
84mph, good length, angled in, fourth stump line, he leaves a tight one to off

caught behind! Five times for Broad! Warner trying to leave made his decision to late! Got a little outside edge before withdrawing the bat. Easy catch for Bairstow! It was a good length but way wide of off. It didn't shape away much. The tightness of the previous leave maybe caused doubt for Warner and he was too late to withdraw the bat!
83mph, good length angled in to middle and leg, he tucks this away neatly to fine leg
83mph good length but well wide and it's an easy leave
good length shape away wide of off, a gently 81mph to warm up, it's left alone easily
back of a length, 78mph, pitching middle, nipping to leg, it comes off thigh guard and runs fine for an extra
83mph, swinging way down the leg side and Bairstow is diving to take it neatly
80mph, shaping into the hip, he tucks this away nicely to fine leg with the angle
back of a length, 84mph, fourth stump line, he defends on the back foot
good length, sixth stump line, 84mph, he leaves it alone
Overpitched and he leans into a lovely square drive! Too full and wide and Harris timed it beautifully backward of point
good length, angled in, shaping away wide of off, he leaves early out of the hand
good length, 83mph, on off, he defends with soft hands to cover and pinches a single with a good early call
82mph, good length, angled into fourth stump, he shuffles back and defends covering off stump well
swinging into leg and he clips it off his pads through square leg! It was in the air over the shoulder of short leg but square of the man who is 5m infront of square and it raced away
huge appeal for LBW but not out. England don't review. Good length, angled in, he was half forward and squeezing a big inside edge onto pad. Was outside the line too. Other than that ... good shout.
84mph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot. Not a big stride forward
good length, angled in and straightening, he closes the face wiping around his front pad and it beats him, taking him on the thigh
good length, 81mph, angled in to the top of off, he's squared up awkwardly on the front foot defending
83mph, angled into middle, he's forward and getting a thick inside edge that runs behind square for a couple
beaten, squared up by an 82mph, good length ball that angled in and nipped away past the groping edge
good length, angled into off, he is defending, squared up on the back foot
84mph, good length, a touch of nip away but well wide of off and he leaves it alone
82mph, stands the seam up and shapes it back but it started wide and never threatened the stumps. An easy leave
81mph, fuller and shaping back to off, he works it with the shape off the front foot to square midwicket
good length, 80mph, well wide and he leaves again
80mph, fuller inswinger, outside off, he leans forward and defends with soft hands
wide tempter, 80mph, Marnus isn't tempted and he lets it pass to Bairstow
85mph, overpitched on off, he pushes forward with lovely timing placing it straight of mid on for a couple
84mph, floaty half volley, on off, he defends though, almost surprised how full it was, pushing it back to the bowler
81mph bouncer and it sails over Bairstow! It was very short, it carried a long way, Bairstow just tipped it over the bar like a goalkeeper for four byes
back of a length outside off, he punches neatly off the back foot, not with power but places it for one
82mph, good length, well wide of off, he is happy to leave
full on the pads and he pings this off the legs through square! That's a gift on leg stump for a Test player and he tucked it away comfortably
83mph, good length angled in, he's caught on the crease, gets a thick inside edge working it to forward square
80mph, fuller on off, he clips this from off stump behind square with the angle, again off a thick inside edge for a couple
83mph, good length, fifth stump line, Harris commits to an early and positive leave
82mph, good length, angling away off the seam, well side of off, he leaves again
good length, angled into off, he's defending with the angle from deep in the crease to square leg

huge LBW appeal and given! Harris reviews. The umpire took awhile and Harris took awhile to send it upstairs. It was a good length angled in, no bat, it nipped past the inside edge but hit the front pad above the knee roll. Ball tracking says it's hitting the bails! Umpire's call and it stays out! He was caught on the crease so height wasn't as big a factor. Good call from Dharmasena.
back of a length, top of off, he's back and defending compactly with the full face
83mph good length off stump, he's squared up and squirting it past point for one
87mph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves it alone on the back foot
86mph, good length, fourth stump, he's back and across and defending from the splice of the bat
bouncer at 86mph, very short and he ducks under it as the crowd cheers
86mph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across to defend easily
83mph, back of a length shaping in, he's back and defending to his feet and then kicking it well away from the stumps. But it was never close
83mph, good length no swing, well wide of off and he leaves it alone
play and miss driving at a tempter, 84mph, fuller length that didn't shape, it held it's line. Beautifully bowled
82mph, good length angled in, he reaches forward defends off the thick inside to short leg. Buttler flicks it onto the stumps from short leg but Marnus got back
good length, 81mph, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
good length, 82mph, wide of off, he makes a late decision but a good one to leave
half volley driven neatly through the vacant point! It was floated up, he was hanging back but his hands are so good that he can just push through the line and punch it forward of point
87mph, back of a length, nipping into the thigh pad, it rolls away to point and Labuschagne is awake at the non strikers to call him through
86mph, back of a length nipping back, he leaves on length, it touches the thigh guard on the way through to Bairstow but too high for any appeal
89mph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves it well on line and length
88mph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending with soft hands to point for an easy single. Good batting
89mph bouncer, very short, he ducks early and easily
good length, 78mph, fifth stump line, trying to shape back but doesn't he watchfully leaves
fuller inswinger, 81mph, shaping into off, he defends with the full face back down the pitch
81mph, fuller inswinger, to middle, he gets a thick inside edge with the swing that runs to fine leg for a single

82mph, full inswinger on leg stump, he's back and across and clipping this behind square, Leach has a long chase around from fine leg and they get three. Nice timing. Broad coaxed into targeting the pads but Smith never misses there
84mph, he's back and across and defending from off stump, a touch squared up
good length, 82mph, wide of off, he leaves
81mph, good length top of off, he's back and across and defending
82mph, good length outswinger, he's back and across and defending with soft hands to cover and taking an easy one
83mph, back of a length on the hip, it comes off the thigh guard and rolls behind square for a leg bye
80mph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and across and defending to mid on
84mph, good length, hint of shape away wide of off and Smith leaves with a flourish
82mph, bouncer, angled down leg and he just ducks gently inside the line
good length, wide of off, he leaves it alone easily
82mph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending from deep in the crease
too full and driven with bottom hand punch! 80mph but overpitched, he didn't get too far out with his hands, just punched with control and placed it and timed it beautifully
back of a length wide of off, he's back and leaving
83mph, fuller length, fifth stump line, he leaves decisively on the front foot
clipped through midwicket! It was another half volley, swinging into leg, he clipped it uppishly to cries of 'catch it', but he placed it forward of the man at forward square. Great shot
length ball on fourth stump shaping away, defended into the covers
length again, holds its line and Smith shoulders arms
shorter outside off, 85mph/137kph, Smith ducks underneath it slightly awkwardly
half-volley outside the off stump, driven out towards extra cover. Not timed, but runs tantalisingly away from Archer for four!
length ball, too straight and whipped ferociously through square leg for four
slightly full of a length, outswinger outside off stump and shoulders arms with a small flourish
around the wicket, slides on with the angle and defended back to the bowler
length outside off, Labuschagne rocks back and slashes this through point for four. Great shot, always in control
same ball, same result. Length ball, enough time to drop deep in the crease and whack this through backward point
a touch fuller and straighter, whacked out to the man who has moved out to deep point and they run one
full and straight, hint of drift, Smith lunges forward and smothers the spin
full on fourth stump, rocks forward and defends into the off side
length ball outside off, 84mph/135kph, grunts on release, wide enough for Smith to leave alone
beaten! Full on fifth stump, drawn forward, and a hint of movement away off the seam to squeeze it past the outside edge
shortish, 85mph/137kph, pulled awkwardly round the corner off the top edge but it spoons up into nomansland, well short of the fielder at long leg
length ball, flying down the leg side, and tickled round the corner down to fine leg. Fairly rank delivery, treated with disdain
full and straight, squirts away off the inside edge down to long leg

massive inswinger, strikes Labuschagne on the front pad but looked high and down leg... oh, England review! Hmm, Stokes didn't look too interested in this initially... but neither did Bumrah for his hat-trick the other day. Impact is in line, but it's moved a mile off the pitch and is only just about clipping the top of leg stump
length ball, Smith scuttles down the track and defends
full and straight, hint of turn and defended back down the track
full and straight again, very wide on the crease, and defended back to the bowler
full and straight, defended out to mid-off with a big stride forward
short leg has moved to short cover, and Smith's attacking shot flies into the pads there
full, skews away off the shoulder of Smith's bat out towards point, good turn there for the spinner
hangs one wide outside off stump, which Labuschagne leaves alone with a Cheshire cat grin
back of a length, on fourth stump, defended into the off side
very wide, another grunt on release, 85mph/137kph, yorker length and bunted out into the off side
hung very wide and left alone
short outside off, pulled out to square leg for a jogged single
length ball, Smith is back and across defending, and this runs away down to third man for a couple
lunges forward on the front foot, worked out to midwicket
length ball outside the off stump, pushed out with soft hands to cover point
length ball, Smith rocks back and punches out into the covers for one
drawn forward, leading edge and juuuust evades the diving right hand of Stokes at slip. Was looking to work into the leg side
full and straight, but drops back deep in the crease and defends into the leg side
ripper! Brilliant delivery, just full of a length, Labuschagne is lunging forward. Biiig turn, and it beats the outside edge
full outside off, and defended into the covers, 81.5mph
full on off stump, 82mph/132kph, and defended
back of a length this time, too straight and worked out to square leg for a jogged single
length outside off, and shoulders arms
hint of movement off the seam, length ball just outside off and left alone with a flourish as it flies through
yorker outside off stump, dug out and defended into the off side
full and straight, lunging forward and defended into the off side
very wide on the crease, full and straight, defended back
length ball, bit of turn away from the bat but Smith works wristily out to square leg
full and straight, on with the arm and Labuschagne, who rocks back, defends into the off side
full and a little leg stump-ish, worked out to mid-on
decent turn again, slightly full of a length, and defended out to cover
full, straight, almost a yorker length, and clipped out to square leg with a helicopter-style flourish by Smith
length ball, on the pads, and steered into the leg side for a couple
full on fourth or fifth stump, hint of movement away, shoulders arms
full and wide outside off, runs the wrists over it as he shoulders arms
length ball, looks to work into the leg side but no run

full on off stump, 85mph/137kph, well dug out for a couple down the ground. Overton stuck a foot out and might have got the end of a spike on it.... and if he'd managed to deflect that onto the stumps at the non-striker's end Smith would have been gone!
full and straight, lunges forward on the defensive
wide on the crease, forward on the defensive and played out to short point/silly cover
down the track a touch, whipped out into the covers with quick hands and they squeeze through for a single
length ball, too straight and on with the arm, clipped out to midwicket
straight length ball, whipped out to backward square for one
full, Smith is down the track looking to work into the leg side but his flick onto finds straight midwicket
full outswinger, exquisite drive by Labuschagne which flies away through cover point for four!
length on fourth stump, looks to drop it into the off side for a single but can only find the fielder

beaten! Delayed appeal from the cordon, but don't think there was anything on that. Length ball, Labuschagne didn't know whether to go forward or back, moved away off the surface and beat the defensive prod
length again, defended comfortably this time
fires in a yorker down the leg side, 85mph/137kph, looks to steer down to fine leg but doesn't get anything on it, a stifled appeal from Bairstow
hangs one outside off, holds its line and Labuschagne shoulders arms
full and straight, wristily whipped into the leg side but finds straight midwicket
full on middle-and-off, driven out to mid-off
full again on fourth stump, defended out towards mid-off
full and a little straighter, worked out to the man at straight midwicket again
full again, dug out by Smith into the leg side, bit of drift in the breeze
full on leg stump, straightens appreciably and Smith defends back to him. Good over from Leach, and a maiden
full outswinger, again draws Labuschagne into the drive and it flies away through point for four! Moves onto 49...
just full of a length, on fourth stump angling in, Smith defends
bumper, 84mph/135kph, and Labuschagne ducks underneath it
length outside the off stump, down at 81mph/130kph, and left alone. Died off the pitch a bit
full, angling into the right-hander, and defends to mid-on
fired down the leg side, looks to whip out into the leg side, but flies through to the keeper
79mph, length ball outside off, gentle pace, Smith pats it to mid off
86mph, he cranks it up, a bumper outside off, he sways underneath it
82mph, he's squared up infront of the stumps trying to work a ball off middle through midwicket, it squirts off the leading edge through a vacant backward point for one
84mph, short ball, lifting outside off, nipping back, he drops the hands and arches the back to sway inside it
squared up, 87mph, length ball, he's getting a thick edge along the ground and it's well stopped in the gully by a diving Burns
85mph, short ball down leg, not sure Labuschagne spotted it early but gets inside the line late
80mph, good length on middle, he's back and across and working this to fine leg to bring up Australia's 100
beaten by a leg cutter that shot low! Good length outside off, angling in and nipping away past a square up Labuschagne, it bounced well short of Bairstow
82mph, fuller outside off, he's in good position to play a textbook forward defence with soft hands
81mph, full on middle, he's back and working this off the stumps to fine leg to bring up his fourth consecutive half century of the series
84mph, good length wide of off, he's back and across and leaving this alone
80mph, good length outside off, it might have stayed low too, Smith is back with the full face dropping the bat on the ball
84mph, good length inswinger, he's infront of his stumps, getting a thick inside edge working it off his pads to fine leg
85mph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending with ease
85mph, bouncer high and down the leg side. Smith barely has to duck but he does
82mph better bumper, not as short outside off, Smith is leaning that way and has to drop his head under it
84mph, short into the ribs, he rides it well, knocking it down off the bottom glove getting it down past short leg and wide of leg slip for a single
86mph, shorter length on middle, he's back and defending off the splice, knocking it down short of Buttler at short leg
over-pitched and hammered through mid on! A long half volley and Smith is balanced and thumping a drive with both feet anchored, straight of mid on and doesn't bother running
78mph, good length outside off, he's back and across and defending
another volley on off, he whips this with the bottom hand wide of mid on this time, long chase for Buttler on the rope running from deep square and he makes the diving save
83mph, good length, some outswing well wide of off and left alone
angled down leg and it comes off the pad and runs fine for four leg byes! He got a long way across and you could see leg. There was an appeal but no review. Hawkeye had it missing leg by some margin
82mph, fuller length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
good length, wide of off, 84mph, he's back and across and defending with ease to mid off
short and wide and hammered backward of point! No point in place and he offers a gift. Smith sat back and cracked the cut shot away
79mph, good length on middle, Smith is back and looks like he has a week to defend it
84mph short and wide but a bit shorter, Smith leaves!? That was a freebie like the previous one. Should have lashed at it with no point in place
88mph, good length, angled in, he's back and defending and then flourishing with the body movement after the defensive stroke to call 'no run'
a bouncer, he ducks early, it passes harmlessly to the keeper
82mph, good length, fifth stump line, he's back and across and defending
81mph, fuller on off, he's forward and defending with ease
79mph, good length wide of off, he's shuffling across to leave
good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave it alone
81mph, half-volley on leg stump, he clips this through square leg to the sweeper
half-volley on leg stump, he whips this easily through square leg
85mph, chest high short ball, he's back and pulling neatly between fine leg and deep square for a couple
85mph, good length wide of off, he's back and across and defending
85mph, back of a length wide of off, he's happy to leave this alone. It swung late as it went to Bairstow
85mph bouncer, he's under it quickly and decisively
87mph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending with the full face
back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending with all the time in the world
79mph, shorter length, he's back and across and defending, getting on top of the bounce well
good length, this stays down a touch after pitching, he drops the hands on it to defend
79mph, shorter outside off, he's back and across to defend with soft hands
good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave
81mph angled down leg, on the hip, he clips this neatly to fine leg
good length, 82mph, wide of off, he leaves it alone
prodded out into the covers off the back foot
short ball, 87mph/140kph, pulled unconvincingly by Smith in front of square, but in control all the time
short again, fired in towards the ribcage, rides the bounce and fends out to midwicket
banana ball! Shaped away through the air and then fired in off the seam, but all from way outside the off stump and the batsman shoulders arms
short and fired down leg, 87mph/140kph, flies through to Bairstow as Marnus leaves it alone
length ball, clipped off the pads down to fine leg for a single
just full of a length, angled in towards off stump, and driven out to mid-on
full and straight, 83mph/134kph, comes forward and this races away off the shoulder of the bat through gully for four. 100 partnership...
length ball, crablike defensive shot off the back foot
outswinger on a length, defended into the off side
back of a length, rides the bounce and punches out into the covers off the back foot. Stokes picks up and throws from cover towards the non-striker's end, but doesn't hit, and he was probably home

inswinger, shoulders arms and a big appeal! But Erasmus says no, and England aren't going to argue with it. Just went in with the angle on a length, struck him on the front pad but missing off by another stump's width
length ball, 82mph/132kph, blocked into the off side and they scuttle through for a single
length ball outside off, Smith is back and across and defends into the off side
full and in at the pads, clipped out to square leg for one
hangs a length ball outside the off stump, leaves alone with a flourish
back of a length, too straight and worked off the hip down to fine leg
full and straight, Smith steps across and works it out to mid-on for no run
full and straight, struck on the pad, big appeal but Erasmus doesn't like it. Looked a touch high. Yeah, struck on the back thigh pad
a little bit of shape away from the right-hander, defended into the covers
length ball, a bit of shape away again and pushed into the covers defensively. Overton looks fired up
fired through towards the pads, 84mph/135kph, worked into the leg side
fired in, full, at leg stump, and defended out to mid-on
unusual shot from Labuschagne, length ball in at fourth stump, plays it very late from under his eyes down towards third man and it races away for four! A few words from Overton...
ha, what a ridiculous way to go to fifty! Length ball, hung miles outside off, gropes at it and knocks himself off his feet as he drives this away to the cover boundary
length ball, walks across the stumps and works for a single to fine leg
hangs this one outside the off stump, no real movement as Labuschagne shoulders arms
leaves it alone again, not much bounce off the surface and dies on its way through to Bairstow
on a length outside off, lets it go
back of a length on off stump, tucked out to square leg off the hip for one
full and straight, worked out to straight midwicket

got 'im! Just full of a length, Labuschagne prods forward, the ball bursts through his defences off the seam, and nicks the top of off on the way through! Overton breaks the stand - a similar ball as the one that brought him his first Test wicket at Adelaide in 2017. Absolute beauty of a delivery
fends at one that shapes across him from over the wicket, and it seams away to beat his dangling bat
fired in at leg stump, a bit overzealous from 'Goober', and Head pings this off his pads out to square leg. That's an easy half-volley to get off the mark
full outswinger, shaping from leg stump towards middle-and-off, Head defends
length ball, steered juuuust wide of the diving man at gully to his left. Not a particularly convincing start from Head
snorter! Angled across him on a length, just a hint of nibble off the seam, and Head is fishing at it outside off
fuller this time, good movement off the seam and squeezed away to third man off the shoulder of the bat. Good running to get back for the third
fires in a yorker towards the off stump, 88mph/142kph, and dug out well from in front of his right boot
back and across Smith comes, and then sways inside a short ball that flies over his right shoulder through to Bairstow
straight, back of a length ball, rides the bounce and steers it down to long leg on the pull
full, fired in towards the off stump, 87mph/140kph, and defended out to mid-off on the half-volley
just full of a length, fired in towards leg stump and worked down to long leg
length ball outside off, defends into the off side
full on fourth or fifth stump, left alone
full and straight, Smith steps across and whips it out to square leg wristily. Fielder catches up with it, but they come back for three
fired across the left-hander, clipped out to the fielder at square leg
81mph/130kph, gentle pace, moves in with the angle and a hint more off the seam, worked into the leg side defensively
Smith steps across and defends to cover point, just full of a length
short ball outside off, Smith steers awkwardly down towards gully where Burns half-stops

yorker, sweeps Head off his feet, massive appeal but not given! England review... looked reasonably convincing in real time. The question is whether it hits him on the front pad on its way through, or just on the back pad. I think it's just the back one....oh, but it's pitched outside leg! Dharmasena's got it spot on
absolute snorter! Angled across the left-hander, dangles his bat prodding forward as this moves away off the seam and beats him
fired in towards leg stump, clipped aerially wide of Buttler at straight midwicket and races away for four
shoulders arms extravagantly as Stokes moves this one across him. Great over by Stokes!
short outside off, steered out to point by Smith
short and straight, pulls down to long leg on the swivel
beaten again, length ball over the wicket, pitching on middle and shaping away from the leftie. Looks to work into the leg side, and can't connect
full of a length, fired in at the pads, loose ball and Head clips off the pads for a boundary! Lovely shot, nicely steered
angled in on a length, Head isn't sure whether to play or leave, and it fires into his dangled bat
hangs it outside the off stump, shoulders arms
edged but well short of third. Good length outside off, he shuffles across to defend with soft hands and it bounces well short
beaten. A poor shot. A little waft at a length ball wide of off. No need to play. England were excited but he missed it
84mph, back of a length, fourth stump, he's back and across and defending and yelling 'not now'. A bit frustrated by his start no doubt
bouncer, it flies harmlessly over his head as he ducks
85mph, good length, outside off, he's back and across to defend
85mph, angled into leg stump, he's back and across and clipping it through square leg
beaten by a leg cutter that seamed away from outside off. It nipped quite appreciably.
glorious back foot cover drive! It was floated up outside off, wasn't a half volley though, he was back and driving off the back foot on the up, caressing it through cover
dropped return catch! And four! A low full toss he smacked a check drive waist high back at Archer, it burst through the hands and went for four!
thick inside edge past leg stump! Wow. This runs to fine leg. he tried another back foot cover drive but it nipped in, came off the thick inside edge but past leg stump safely
good length angled into off, he's back and across and defending to mid on
spar and miss outside off. It was back of a length, nipping away and he fended and missed.
short ball, he tries to pull but mistimes it to backward square
84mph, good length outside off, fifth stump, he's back and leaving late but well
82mph, bouncer, he ducks under it easily
good length, 82mph, angled into off, he defends from deep in the crease
bouncer, 84mph, angled over leg, Smith is under it quickly and calmly
83mph, back of a length on off, he's back with heaps of time to work it through forward square to retain the strike
85mph, good length, nipping back and hitting him on the thigh guard. There's been some seam movement this morning
85mph, bouncer, Smith ducks late but does well
84mph, shorter outside off, he fends away from his body knocking it down. Not a conventional defensive shot. He didn't need to play
86mph, shorter and wider again, he is happy to leave this alone
90mph back of a length wide of off, he's back and across and defending comfortably despite the speed gun spiking
another bouncer at 88mph, but he's under it early and it dies a bit on the way through to Bairstow
84mph, back of a length angling in, he's back and punching with a vertical bat to point
84mph, angled into leg, he whips this wide of fine leg, Head pushes for two but turns blind, he wisely saw Leach had it and calls no
80mph, good length outside off, he shuffles back and across and works this to midwicket with ease

LBW! Head talks to Smith but doesn't review. That looked pretty adjacent. Angled in on a fuller length, Head's eyes drifting outside the line, he drives hard down the wrong line and is hit flush on the knee roll infront of middle and leg. Height and angle maybe a query but he was on the crease. He didn't review.
fuller wide of off, 84mph, he's happy to leave
84mph, angled into middle and leg, he works this with the angle wide of mid on
86mph, angled into middle, full, he's defending on the front foot but not a long way forward
87mph, bouncer, angled over leg but he ducks well
87mph, angled in from around the wicket to leg, he clips this to the man at forward square
back of a length angled into off, he's defending from the crease towards point
ducks into a back of a length ball! It wasn't short, he turned his back and his head and got hit on the ribs

edged and it just falls short of Root at first! Angled in, nipping away, 89mph, he's squared up, edges and it just falls short of first slip, Root can't gather on the half volley and it runs away for two
chest high short ball, he's back with heaps of time, puling with control to deep square
82mph, angled down leg, it comes off the hip and runs fine but Bairstow knocks it down
play and miss! A booming drive at a ball that angled in and nipped away late! Great length and line luring him in
83mph, back of a length on off, he's squared up, defending to the gully
full on leg, 85mph, he glances this with the angle to fine leg
82mph bouncer, he shapes to pull but bails out and it sails over his head
fuller on off, he slices a drive inside out through cover for one
back of a length, 76mph, wide of off, he mistimes a back foot drive given it didn't come onto him
bouncer, high, outside off, and he ducks easily
lovely late cut! Gorgeous shot. He waited on a length ball wide off, he sat back, waited and guided it off an open blade through the vacant gully along the ground.
good bouncer, not as short, targeting the ribs, 91mph, he ducks inside it ... just
higher bouncer that he gets underneath
back of a length, he's back and defending to the gap at cover. Good running
84mph, fuller angled into middle, he shuffles back and across and works it to backward square
a pull in the air but fine of deep leg gully! Stokes never saw it. It runs wide of fine leg and they sprint two
82mph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending with the full face
83mph, bouncer, too high and it's easy for Smith to duck under
83mph, angled across him wide of off and he leaves it with a flourish
88mph, good length, top of off, he's defending on the move trying to get forward
89mph, fuller on middle and off, he gets a slight leading edge defending around his front pad
87mph, cracking bumper, angling in, he dropped the knees and swayed inside it watching it all the way
88mph, good length, he thinks about leaving but runs it off the face along the ground to gully
angled way down the leg side
90mph, back of a length on middle, he's back and taken on the thigh guard, it rolls away for a leg bye
85mph, good length, fifth stump line, angling in and shaping away, he leaves
over-pitched, 84mph, he leans into a nice drive, placing it wide of mid off for a couple
good length but way wide of off and he leaves
82mph, fuller on off, he drives nicely but Broad does very well to field in his follow through
84mph, good length, angled in and shaping away, he's squared up, running it off an open face along the ground to gully
good length, wide of off, he's leaving watchfully
87mph, good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending off the back foot
87mph, shorter ball, rising but Smith has so much time on the back foot to knock it down into the leg side and call Wade through

angled past gully and it runs away. Well controlled. It was 89mph, good length, he was forward but with soft hands he opened the face a touch, used the pace and angled it through backward point and it raced away
squared up awkwardly defending on the front foot. He locked the front knee and groped at it but kept it out
over-steps as he fires a short ball, angled into leg, Wade ducked late but well enough

huge appeal for caught behind. Erasmas is unmoved. No review. It was a quick bouncer, Wade took on the pull shot but he missed it. There was no noise. Nothing on snicko. Just an appeal for the sake of it
angled into leg and it runs off the pad fine for extras. Too straight. Wade will be disappointed he didn't make contact but it's four to the total
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and drives through cover-point to the sweeper
tossed up on leg, he whips it powerfully into the shin of Buttler at short leg. Cries of catch but it wasn't a chance
a paddle sweep off the arm and pops up, Stokes runs from slip anticipating the shot but doesn't catch it. It wasn't out anyway
shorter length on leg, he's back and defending
skipping down and lofting over midwicket! Good footwork to get down to the pitch and whip with the spin, flat over midwicket. Positive shot
fuller on off, he's forward and pushing it to mid off
85mph/137kph bumper to start, Smith ducks underneath it
banged in short again with a hint of movement, 84mph/135kph, ducks again
back-of-a-length ball just outside off, knocked out to midwicket for one
length ball, angling in, defended back to the bowler
wide on the crease and angling in, prodded out to cover
slightly wider this time, punched out to mid-off off the back foot
full and straight, Smith comes forward and defends
length ball, hint of turn, Smith turns it around the corner, sets off, is sent back and Bairstow's throw doesn't quite hit! Would have been back but a real mix-up
ooft, brilliant, elegant whip through midwicket on one leg. All along the floor, beautiful stroke
beaten! All happening here. Bit of turn and bounce for Leach, pitched on middle and spun past the bat. Smith gives a nod in appreciation
drawn forward again, defended under his eyes to the man at very short cover
length ball, Smith meets it with a characteristically bizarre wristy flourish which dribbles out to the cover sweeper for one
back of a length outside off, Smith is back and across and dabs it to point
back of a length, looks to work to square leg and flicks the thigh pad
angled in from round the wicket, worked out to square leg
full, on with the angle towards the off stump, and defended by Wade
slightly full of a length, driven out to mid-off. Wade not quite timing it just yet
straight length ball, doesn't get up much off the pitch, and worked to mid-on
length ball, no turn at all as it goes on with the arm and Smith flicks it off his leg stump out to long leg for a couple
hint of turn, draws Smith forward and defends into the covers
full and straight, whipped out into the midwicket region for a jogged single
around the wicket, fired across the left-hander and defended out to cover

length outside off, has a massive heave which goes miles up in the air... Root at mid-on watches it fly up, has enough time to set himself, roll up his sleeves, finish off his cup of tea and then pouch it. Brainless shot! Bit of a nothing ball from a negative angle, Wade hadn't got going at all and lost his patience, hoping to mow this over cow corner, and top-edged it straight up
half-volley on fourth stump, driven out to the fielder at mid-off
bumper, Smith ducks underneath it and it sails harmlessly through to the keeper
back of a length on off stump, and an outrageous helicopter-style tap out to the man at square leg for a single
back of a length, defended off the back foot out to cover
hangs this one outside off, Paine leaves it alone
short one, nicely played, doesn't get all of it but pulls well for one. Rib-height, or thereabouts
full outside off, and steered with open hands to the left of the gully fielder. Third man mops up
drawn forward, defends to short cover
length ball that turns outside off, Smith stretches at it and it flies off the outside edge of a strange wristy flick down to backward point
comes down the pitch, thrusts his pad at it, bit of excitement
too short this time, Smith rocks back and knocks it out to cover point for one
full on fourth stump, not much turn this time, Paine is forward in defence
length outside off, Paine square drives out to the sweeper on the off side for one
short ball, 84mph/135kph, ducks underneath it
just back of a length, fired down the leg side and lets it go
short again, pitched outside off and moves appreciably late. Paine ducks underneath it
length ball angling in, on fourth stump, Paine jumps back and defends
short and straight, pretty easy pace at 82mph/132kph, and pulled around the corner to long leg
outswinger, pitches outside leg and Smith nurdles out to the sweeper at midwicket
full on off stump, driven to the mid-off fielder
length ball, rocks back and nudges it to square leg
full on leg stump, steered out to the man at straight midwicket
full on off stump, defended to mid-off
draws Paine forward, defends back down the pitch
full on off stump, driven out to mid-off. Steady, steady
back of a length ball, tucked off the hip out to deep square for an easy single
back of a length, doesn't get up at all off the pitch, 81mph/130kph, and nudged into the leg side
length ball, outswinger outside off which Paine just about drags his bat inside at the last moment
length outside off, left alone
angled in on a length, 84mph/135kph, defends
length ball, Paine defends slightly awkwardly, looking to nudge it into the leg side
straight length ball, Smith works out to square leg for one
full and straight, a bit of flight from Leach, and worked for a quick single to mid-on
length ball, grips off the surface, clonked out to sweeper cover
full and straight, not much flight, defended under his eyes
slightly wider outside off, Paine thinks about flaying it through point but leaves it alone
straight again, and defended with a full face
bumper, way over Smith's head, 86mph/138kph, and ducks underneath it. Called wide, was very loopy
length ball angling across him, nudged out to square leg from outside off and Smith moves to 99
length ball, draws Paine into the pull shot but a controlled one out to square leg for one

full on leg stump, clipped off the pads out to square leg where there's a slight misfield and they squeeze through for a couple. Smith passes 100 for the third time this series, his fifth in his last eight innings against England, and the crowd rise in applause. Amazing innings, amazing player. Celebrates briefly, but looks like he's only completed part of the task!
back to the task, length ball defended into the off side
shuffles across, defends under his nose
short ball angling across, 86mph/138kph, drops the hands to leave alone
full on fourth or fifth stump, defended out into the off side
length ball, bit of grip, slashed out to the man at point
full and straight, Paine looks to work to mid-on for one but mistimes back to Leach
half-volley with a bit of flight, exquisitely timed for four through extra cover
wide on the crease, good turn on a length, and defended out to cover
tossed up, full outside off, good diving stop by Roy at cover keeps them to a single. Might have winded himself a bit in the process
80mph, back of a length on off, he's back and bunting this with ease to the gap at midwicket
83mph, good length but way wide of off and Paine shows no interest. Hint of shape as it goes to Bairstow
81mph, good length, angled into off, he slices a forward defence to forward point
dropped by Roy at second slip! A wide ball, he's invited to drive, takes it on, gets it off the toe of the bat, the edge flies low but straight to Roy and he spills it!
fuller inswinger, angled in off, he defends on the front foot falling over
81mph, fuller outswinger, wide of off, he leaves this alone this time
tossed up, he reaches out and drives inside out to mid off
he skips out early, covers the line and pushes on the up to mid on
looped up higher and fuller, he drives inside out, firmly to deep cover
tossed up, nice shape, he stretches out and defends with soft hands to silly mid off
looped up higher, a touch shorter, he reaches forward again to defend
flatter and quicker on off, he defends with firm hands back to the bowler
83mph, fuller outswinger, he's back and across and defending to cover
thumping back foot cover drive! A length ball outside off, he's camped back and like a caribbean king of yesteryear he played a flourishing back foot cover drive and placed it in the gap!
shorter and tighter to off, he's back and across and tucking it behind square like he's playing in the backyard
83mph, good length, hint of away shape, wide of off, he leaves
beaten all ends up by a cracking leg cutter! Angled in, nipping away, he's caught on the crease squared up. Just missed the edge. World class bowling
84mph, wider half-volley he climbs into a cover drive and nails it ... straight to the cover fielder

howling swipe from Smith flies high but lands safe short of deep cover! What was that? He charged down and tried to launch down the ground, sliced it high towards deep cover but miscued and it lands safe!
flatter on off, he pushes forward back to the bowler
too short and wide and he hammers a cut shot! That's a gift at this level. A freebie and he was back, smacking it through cover
tossed up outside off, he's happy to leave
darted into leg, 55mph, he's back and tucking this forward of square
looped up on middle, he stretches out and defends
half volley met with the full face! Superb straight drive. It was a loosener and Paine leaned forward and punched it straight of mid on. Lovely shot
angled into leg, he glances this to fine leg, pushes for two but it's not on
hooked fine of fine leg! It wasn't full blooded. A bouncer and he just steps inside and controls a hook, placing it fine of Leach
dabbed between second slip and gully! Ridiculous shot! Short outside off, he leans back, opens the face and places it in a gap of about 3 metres between the fielders. Incredible skill
over-steps, it's a good length outside off, he's back and across and defending
flash and miss trying to hit a half volley off the back foot through cover. He tried to smoke it too.
good length on off, he's back and working this neatly with control to the gap at midwicket

edged to slip! Smith is out! Leach and Stokes combine again! Brilliant piece of bowling. Hang on ... hang on. Is it a no ball? Oh no. It's a no ball for over-stepping! The most criminal of acts! Leach had overstepped. No debate. Nothing behind the line. Smith gets a reprieve. It was a such a good delivery. Tossed up, spinning away, luring a flick drive, got the edge and Stokes took a simple shin high catch. Alas ...
tossed up, outside off, he leaves this alone
very full drifting in, he whips this to midwicket
charges to a length ball and it forced to defend as it grips
shorter length, he's back and stroking this with the vertical bat through point to the sweeper
looped up, he drives neatly to mid off and runs with the stroke as the man is deeper than normal
shorter length, he's back and whipping this through square leg
83mph, fuller length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot

he nearly defends it onto the stumps! It was a fuller length, he hung back, defended with soft hands, it bounces high and behind him but over the stumps. Smith chased it to make sure it didn't hit the stumps. He knocked it away and Bairstow gave him a mouthful
fuller on off, he clips this behind square with the angle
87mph, good length, outside off, he makes a late call to leave but it's a good one
another no ball, fuller outswinger, he pushes a drive wide of mid off and runs with the stroke
86mph, good length wide of off, he shuffles across and leaves whipping the bat away
wide full toss, smacked through cover-point! Horror delivery and Smith just clattered it into the gap
tossed up, he drives to Root at a deeper mid off, they run an easy one despite Root throwing the stumps down at the non-striker's
49mph, slower, higher, he drives into the feet of Buttler at silly mid off
he charges to a length ball, gets tangled, taken on the pad, has to retreat quickly as Buttler swoops
length ball, some bounce but not much turn, he's back and defending
54mph, flatter outside off, he's back and defending
drifting in fuller, he reaches out to defend
looped up on off, 50mph, no turn, he stretches forward and defends
tossed up again, he reaches out and defends
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover
leg break, floated up, well pitched, he stretches out and defends
looped full and wide, he frees the arms and smacks a drives straight to cover
shorter, flatter and quicker, he zips back quickly, cuts firmly but straight to backward point
shorter length, he's back and cutting to deep point
drifting into middle, nice shape, he reaches out and defends, needing to wait for it
53mph, shorter, and some width, he's back and cutting to deep point
49mph, tossed up, outside off, he steps out and defends
drifting into off, he's forward and defending with the full face
shorter length, he's back and tucking this off the hip through square leg
ripping leg break outside off, he leaves this alone
tossed up very full, he swipes it across the line to deep midwicket for a single
flatter on middle, he reaches out defending and gets thick inside edge behind square
shorter length on leg, he's back and clipping this to deep midwicket
shorter length, he's working this behind square but can't pick the gap he wanted
full toss on leg, he whips this to deep midwicket
80mph back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and across, punching this firmly to mid on
80mph, shorter on middle, he shuffles inside the line and clips it off the hip to deep backward square
a bumper angled down leg, he shaped to play and wisely withdrew inside the line
84mph, short and wide, he cracks a very neat cut shot through point! Too easy. Lovely shot. He seized the length quickly
85mph, he went leave, left the bat outside off, it ran off the face and along the ground to gully
84mph, fuller angled into off, no shape, he pushes with the full face to mid off
82mph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending
83mph, shorter length, outside off, fourth stump, he's back and across and knocking it easily to midwicket
83mph, better length, on off, he's forced to defend on the front foot, only half forward though
83mph, rising bouncer outside off, he dugs under it well
83mph, bouncer again, over middle and leg, he ducks quickly and wisely
back of a length, off stump, he's back and defending to cover
very full on off, he's back and getting the front leg out of the way to whip behind square for a couple
83mph, fires this down the leg side, Smith walks across infront of his stumps but misses out as it swings down leg
sumptuous cover drive! This is superb. Over-pitched wide of off but angling across, he eased into a cover drive. Just leaned on it. Beautiful stroke
86mph, full and wide, he's hanging back and square driving to deep point
82mph short ball, he pulls but rolls the wrists to keep it down in getting it to deep square
yorker, 87mph, on off, Smith is sitting back in his crease, he drops the bat down with ease to block it
85mph, half volley leg stump, he clips this through midwicket, hasn't timed it but places it well enough
84mph, again on leg stump, not as full, he pushes this towards mid on and calls immediately for an easy one
77mph, slower ball, on middle, he sits back and works this behind square to rotate again
87mph fuller outside off, his weight is back and he mistimes a drive to mid off. That was there to drive
87mph, bouncer, outside off, he drops the hands and sways underneath it
88mph, shorter length again, he's back and riding the bounce to defend to point
85mph short ball down leg, he steps inside the line and and bails out of a potential stroke
85mph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it easily
88mph, angled down leg he shuffles across and misses out trying to glance
beaten by a beauty. Good length, angling in a touch and straightening, he's squared up, defending and it flies past the edge
squared up again to a fuller length, playing with angled bat, gets a  leading edge that flies behind point
angled to leg stump, he's back and clipping this wide of fine leg and calls for two straight away
good length, fourth stump line, he defends half forward, off a thick inside edge onto pad
thumping square drive! Full wide half volley and Paine climbs in. Gets a balanced stride, weight forward, sweet swing of the bat through the line and it flies to the rope
85mph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves this alone
87mph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it
88mph angled down leg and he misses out
back of a length, on off, he's back and defending
length ball on fourth stump, defended back off the back foot
length outside the off stump, and Smith is beaten! Draws him forward, little bit of deviation with a scrambled seam, and squares him up
similar length but a touch wider, shoulders arms this time
length outside off again, left alone again
full and straight, plays this front-on and with open wrists, squeezes away off the outer half of the bat into the gully
length on off stump, Smith shuffles across and nurdles it into the leg side for a scuttling single
hangs an outswinger outside the off stump, down at 78mph/126kph, left alone
outswinger on a length, shoulders arms again
length outside off, has a prod and plays it out to cover
full and quite straight, hits him on the pad, only a strangled appeal. Jagged in, Smith looked to play it into the leg side, hit on the bottom of the thigh pad in fact
length outside off, and a big swooshing leave from Smith
length outside off, hint of movement off the seam, left alone
back of a length, very, very wide outside the off stump moving away. No idea how that isn't called a wide, really!
short ball, and Paine (surprise, surprise) takes on the hook and it trickles out towards long leg for a single
fullish outswinger, appreciable movement away off the seam, Smith lets it go
length ball, big, late inswing, and Smith plays this well, very late under his eyes and squeezed out into the leg side
hangs one outside off on a length, Paine is caught in two minds as to whether he should play, ends up withdrawing the bat
inswinger, nurdled down to fine leg
length outside the off stump, and Paine leaves it alone
bumper, fired down the leg side, Paine tries to pull but doesn't get bat on it
full outside off, bit of a half-volley and Paine times sweetly through extra cover for four! Not the most aesthetically pleasing shot but got his weight right and timed it to perfection
length ball angling in, left alone
full outswinger, but too wide of off stump and left alone. 80mph/129kph, pretty military medium this
hung outside the off stump, left alone
inswinger, just full of a length, and flicked off the pads into the leg side for a single
length outside off, dropped into the covers
hangs one very full outside off, and Paine slashes one through cover point for four! Sweetly timed again, as Paine nears fifty
full and straight, Paine digs it out and times a clipped drive down the ground... Archer pulls out the dive at mid-on and claws it back to save a run
bumper outside off, Smith shuffles across then ducks out the way of it
full and straight, clonked out to sweeper cover on the half-volley for one
straight, length ball, Smith shuffles across and tucks it away for a single like we've seen so many times in this series
full and fired down the leg side, left alone
full and straight, Paine defends from front-on back to the bowler
full outside the off stump, left alone
just full of a length on the off stump, angling in, very well bowled and Paine inside edges onto his back thigh
outswinger on a length, shapes away and left alone
full on fourth or fifth stump, 83mph/134kph, very tight to the stumps and left alone by Smith

short outside off, Smith rides the bounce and launches a pull shot through midwicket on the front foot... they come back for three and Smith has 150! His 8th such score in Tests, and his third against England. Whadda player!
short ball, ducks underneath it
short again, Paine ducks underneath it
short outside off, back over the wicket, 88mph/142kph and pulled unconvincingly into the leg side

short outside off, and shelled! By Sam Curran of all people! Paine pulls on the front foot, straight to Curran and straight midwicket/wide mid-on, and puts down the easiest of chances. Archer and Root both seething
hangs a very gentle length ball outside off, 79mph/127kph, left alone and dies off the pitch
length ball on off stump, prodded defensively into the covers
hangs one full outside off, 79mph again, nothing ball, no plan, Smith whacks this through extra cover as if to ask 'is that all you've got?' and picks up four for his troubles
fuller still, outside off again, dug out off the toe
length outside off, dabbed into the covers off the back foot
half-volley outside off, bunted out to the fielder at cover. All a bit flat from England just at the minute, Paine and Smith in cruise control!
bumper outside off, 87mph/140kph, ducks underneath it
back of a length, straight ball that moves away off the seam, Paine defends firmly off the back foot
short ball, 85mph/137kph, gets up off the surface past the throat and Paine sways inside the line of it
short ball outside off, Paine takes on the pull but doesn't get much on it and it dribbles out to short leg
short outside off, 87mph/140kph, ducks underneath it
short, straight ball, doesn't take on the hook and ducks beneath it
full on fourth stump, Smith shuffles across and blocks it to mid-on
half-volley on off stump, belted down to long-on by Smith with complete disdain
fired in at the pads, tucked out to deep midwicket for a couple
bumper outside off, 83mph/134kph, doesn't get up off the pitch but Smith just about gets inside it, swaying out the way
short ball, swatted away down to Leach at long leg on the bounce, almost like he's hitting a fly with a rolled-up newspaper, and they shuffle through for a single
short outside off, things about pulling but gets out the way of it, and Paine is still on 49, 15 balls after he reached that score
back of a length, steered out into the gully on the bounce where Stokes fields well
short ball, tickled down to fine leg off the glove for four just out of Bairstow's reach
short outside the off stump, left alone by Smith
bumper outside off, drops the hands
short ball in at the ribs, prodded out to short leg
wild short ball, 91mph/145kph, flies harmlessly over his right shoulder and through to Bairstow
full and straight, worked to straight midwicket
tossed up, full and straight, driven out to extra cover and Paine finally reaches 50! His sixth in Tests, and first of the series. Shaky start but has dug in well
length ball outside leg, into the rough, and Smith prods forward
fuller on leg stump, flamingoed out to mid-on but fielded comfortably enough
length outside leg stump, and tickled around the corner for one
good turn out of the rough on a length, Paine tries to kick it away and it spills out off the pad into the off side
short ball outside off, slashed down to third man where Denly fields on the bounce. Looks for a moment like it might carry, but fell well short
back of a length, on fourth stump, Paine shoulders arms
straight bumper, Paine nonchalantly shoulders arms. Bairstow looks in a bit of pain, might have taken that on the end of the thumb
fullish outside off, pushed out into the covers where Broad slips over and they come back for a couple. Might have been half a chance if he hadn't hit the turf
short and straight, Paine ducks underneath it. 88mph/142kph
back of a length outside off, 90mph/145kph, and carved away through backward point by Paine. Good battle between these two
fires it into the rough outside leg, Smith charges down, knocks it into the leg side, and scuttles back
fuller into the rough, rocks back and tucks it out to square leg
full outside leg, Paine bunts it away into the off side
full on leg stump, worked out to straight midwicket
length ball outside leg, decent turn and driven out to mid-off for a quick single
full into that rough again, and nudged away square of the wicket
full and straight, hint of drift, prodded back to the bowler
loopy flighted ball on leg stump, tickled slightly aerially off the inside edge out to fine leg
full and straight, no real turn, defended back to the bowler
full on middle-and-leg, worked out to square leg
back of a length, pretty filthy really, and Smith slams it through midwicket of the back foot
tossed up, full and straight, blocked back to the bowler

caught behind! What a peach! 74mph but a beautiful leg cutter! It was a scrambled seam angled in, perfect length, it bounces and seams away a touch, Paine gropes forward trying to defend, feathers an edge and Bairstow celebrates a simple catch.
back of a length on middle and leg, he's squared up in defence
too straight and glanced fine. This was angled down and Cummins plays a neat leg glance and it runs away
76mph, floaty full ball, he pushes forward placing it to mid off
75mph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends half forward opening the face and running it to point
80mph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot
full toss and it's hammered over long on! He was charging early anyway but it was a knee high full toss and he just clubbed it over long on and it carries all the way
he's back to try and cut one that slides on and he chops a bottom edge down onto the crease line
floated up, good length, 48mph, he reaches out and defends
51mph, some turn but it's shorter, he's back and punching this to the gap at cover-point
tossed up, drifting in to middle and leg, he defends on the front foot with the full face
flatter, drifting into off, he defends on the front foot
78mph, outswinger way wide of off and called wide
good length sixth stump line outside off and he leaves
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone again with disdain
good length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone
78mph, good length outswinger well wide of off, again he shows no interest in playing
fuller and wide of off, 81mph, he steps back and across to defend a ball he didn't need to play
80mph back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and across, knocking this into the leg side
tossed up on off, he leans out to defend
beautiful footwork to get there on the full and whipped this through midwicket. So quick to get down. It was too full and too straight and he pinged it square of midwicket
good length, outside off, he's back and pushing this to point
shorter and wider, he's back and cutting firmly to deep point
tossed up on off, he leans out and defends

edged and caught at slip! Sharp turn and an easy catch for Stokes. He didn't over step this time. Nice loop, drifting in outside off, it gripped and bounced, took the edge and Stokes took an easy catch, knee high at slip
good length, wide of off, he's shuffling across and leaving it alone again
fifth stump line, 80mph, he's back and across, defending, knocking it down
very wide outswinger, 78mph, Smith watches it all the way past
back of a length, 79mph, wide of off, he's back and defending with soft hands
good length wide of off, well wide, 82mph, he is back and across and leaving
back and across to a wide length ball, he's squared up trying to knock it to the leg side
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and defends on the front foot
52mph, flatter on off, he's forward and defending with a big stride
shorter length, he's back and working this to short leg
55mph, flatter on off, he's back and defending
tossed up on middle, he pushes this firmly to mid on
quicker and straighter on middle, he works this with the angle to midwicket
he steps outside off early, Overton goes fuller but still wide, 81mph, he's forced to defend
good length well wide of off, he leaves once more
so he smashes a pull shot wide of mid on! 80mph, half tracker outside off, he stands tall and smacks it along the ground wide of mid on
good length wide of off again, he leaves with a flourish of the bat
77mph, half volley, he's hanging back and tries a back foot drive but mistimes it back to the bowler
77mph, wide outswinger, he leaves again with a flourish
tossed up, some turn back into the left hander, he defends it well though on the front foot
flatter on off, he drives firmly down to long on to get off the mark
shorter length, wide of off, he's back and cutting easily to deep point
tossed up on middle, he's forward to defend
flatter on middle, 52mph, he defends with a big stride out
54mph, tossed up outside off, he defends with a full face back to the bowler
79mph, good length way wide of off and he leaves
78mph, good length outswinger outside off, he is leaving again
so wide he fell over trying to square drive! It was a big wide tempter, he threw himself at the ball but came off his feet
too wide this time as Smith glares at the umpire to ensure it's called
79mph, good length, sixth stump line, he leaves again
he steps outside off early, it's still a good length and wide, Smith defends trying to work to leg
76mph, good length sixth stump line, he isn't interested in playing
tossed up, he presses forward and drives neatly to a very deep mid on for one
drifting into middle and leg, he steps forward and defends
plays and misses trying to cut. There was width and it was short and Smith was annoyed he missed it
beaten by one that drags him forward and spins and bounces past the bat as he defends
slower and higher outside off, he reaches out and defends
good length on off, he reaches out to defend with the full face
good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
play and miss driving on the up at a 78mph ball that just wobbled away off a good length
edged and it falls short of Stokes at second slip. He pushed hard on the up, got a genuine edge and it dropped well short
78mph, good length wide of off, he checks his drive punching it to cover
crunched down the ground! Floated up at 80mph, straighter line, he swings through the line driving powerfully back past the bowler and no need to run
good length, wide of off, he is happy to leave
launched over wide long off! What a shot! He skipped down, stayed leg side, opened the shoulders and launched over wide long off and cleared the rope. What a way to bring up 400 for Australia
drifting to leg, he clips it off his pads but can't beat square leg
53mph, tossed up outside off, he reaches out and pushes to cover-point
short and wide, he's back and late cutting, it nearly beats the man but a good diving save prevents the extra runs
flatter on off, he's forward and defending
51mph, tossed up, he drives firmly but drags it along the ground to mid on
shorter outside off, he punches with a vertical bat but can't beat back point
he steps outside off, Overton fires it even wider and he leaves
short and wide, he late cuts but straight to third man and only gets one. He threw his head back as he saw it going to the fielder
76mph, bouncer, very high outside off, Starc ducks easily
play and miss flirting on the up at one that pitched on a good length and nipped away past the edge
back of a length wide of off, 78mph, he's leaving this alone
80mph, shorter outside off, he stepped a long way across and worked this behind square but found Burns, Starc ran but was sent back. He took a while to turn but got home OK
another tuck behind square from outside off! Steve Smith putting on another masterclass. That's his third double century in Tests. Phenomenal. He got a standing ovation that drowned out any boos.
79mph, good length wide of off, he leaves with a flourish again
good length outside off, he steps forward and defends
a flash and miss driving on the up outside off
glorious on drive straight of mid on! This was fuller and in his arc and he crunched it down the ground
tossed up, outside off, he leans forward to defend
drifting into middle, he whips this powerfully with the drift, against the turn straight of deep midwicket
spins and bounces past the outside edge out of the footmarks
huge swing and miss, again it spun out of the footmarks
quicker but spinning again at 60mph, he's back and forcing to point
big appeal for LBW but there was a big inside edge and England don't review the not out call. It was straight but he squeezed it off the inside edge onto pad
83mph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending to cover
full toss on off, 86mph, he whips this behind square to the man in the deep
angled down leg and he tickles this fine! Too straight from around the wicket and he glanced it off the hip
magnificent straight drive! One of the shots of the day. 83mph in the slot and he plays a straight drive of the highest quality. Held the pose as it clattered into the fence
the lofted on drive this time! Full again and he hits powerfully straight through the line, checking it straight of mid on!
sliced in the air behind point! His footwork wasn't as good, this was wider, but he flashes hard, got a thick outside edge and it flies behind point and runs away for four in a row!
Smith backs away and shows all three stumps, it's shorter on middle, he slaps a cut to deep cover
fast and drifting into middle, he squeezes it off the inside half of the bat onto pad
arm ball, sliding on, he jams the bat down knocking it to a gap at point
a brilliant fine sweep! This was down leg, he strides out and sweeps hard from high to low like a kayaker to get it fine

caught on the reverse sweep at backward point! He's finally out. He reverse sweeps hard and flat but straight to the man at backward point who finally holds on! It was a leg break from Root, he picked and smoked the reverse sweep but found Denly
he pushes on the front foot to cover-point
angled down leg, 79mph, loosener and he misses out on the glance
back of a length, 82mph, he's back and defending
hooked off the top edge just wide of fine leg! It was good bouncer, he played the hook but wasn't in control, it carried a long way in the air but landed just out of reach of Leach
a play and miss at a short ball outside off
cut away through point! This was 82mph but on a tee outside off, he stands up and cuts hard through the vacant point
short outside off, 82mph, again there's width, he cuts but straight to backward point
darted into off, he's forced to bail out of a slog sweep and defends
monstrous slog sweep! In the arc, he was down on one knee and it went miles into the stands

huge appeal for LBW, given not out. England review. It looks close. He tried to paddle sweep a ball from off stump but he got a touch off the glove before it hit pad. It would have been plumb if not for the glove. England lose the review and Australia get a run
strong sweep behind square to the sweeper
a genuine mow across the line wide of long-on! It was wide of off, he just freed the arms and clubbed it wide of long on
slog sweep into the gap at deep midwicket! That's Starc's zone. There is no fielder there and Root keeps feeding it. He was down on one knee again
bumper, Lyon has a slash but can't connect
short ball, Lyon upper cuts elegantly, flies out down to third man on the bounce
angled across the leftie, who leaves it alone. Good carry through to Bairstow
bumper, 89mph/143kph, ducks underneath it
short ball outside off, Starc has a slash... flies down to third man off the outside edge where Buttler nearly takes an outrageous catch, but it flies out of his reach over the rope!
length ball from round the wicket, 89mph/143kph, pushed out to cover off the back foot and they get through for a couple
length on leg stump, nudged into the leg side
very wide on the crease, length ball nurdled into the leg side
floaty offie outside the off stump, left alone
leggie from round the wicket, knocked out into the covers
leggie from wide on the crease, boshed out to long-on and they jog through for a single
length ball, pitches on leg and goes on with the angle, punched into the leg side for one
short ball, gorgeous upper cut from Lyon but he doesn't get all of it, and it skews down to the fine third man for one
sharp short ball, and Starc ducks underneath it, 88mph/142kph
nurdles one off the hip into the leg side to bring up a 10th Test fifty! Very handy counterattacking knock
short and wide outside the off stump, Lyon looks to flay it away and can't connect. Cricket is definitively not the winner.
fuller outside off, squeezed away to point where Denly makes a good diving stop
bumper, Lyon steps away looking to swat it through the leg side but can't connect
floaty off-break outside the off stump, mowed out to cow corner on the bounce
legbreak from wide on the crease, nudged into the on side for a single
aims up a massive heave over long-on, but it turns out of the rough past the bat and he can't connect
punched out into the covers off the back foot, length ball
aims up another enormous heave over midwicket, nowhere near connecting, and Bairstow knocks the bails off even with Starc never leaving his crease
full on the off stump, worked out into the leg side, and they come back for a quick two despite Roy's best efforts in the deep. Gone with a better piece of work by Root
backs away, full just outside off, looks to whack this through the covers and doesn't connect
backs away but Archer follows him, gets decent bat on it trying to carve it through the on side but midwicket fields
backs away, has a slash at the short ball, and top edges it away for four over the keeper's head!
backs away, smites it down to long leg via an inside edge
sharp short ball, squeezed out to backward point, 89mph/143kph. Good wheels from Archer this spell
short ball, prodded out into the covers, Archer scampers after it and they don't take the run
pitches outside leg, Lyon sweeps, doesn't get any bat on it but it turns a fair bit and beats Bairstow. Fifty partnership!
full on off stump, swept hard out to Archer at square leg
short and wide offbreak, Starc carves it out to cover for no run
flighted up, Starc gives it the big heave-ho... but can only find the fielder at deep midwicket
straight length ball, Lyon waltzes down the track and launches this over midwicket for a one-bounce four! Bosh!
full outside leg, sweeps out of the rough...
length outside off to start, gets up off a length, but left alone happily enough
straighter this time, and blocked back down the pitch. 90mph/145kph
scattergun start, 89mph/143kph, Starc fires this very wide of off stump and Burns lets it go
better line, 89mph/143kph, but a touch short and Burns leaves alone on length
hooping outswinger, back of a length outside off, good carry off the pitch through to Paine but left alone
outswinger outside off, slightly fuller, and Burns plays inside the line of it. Maiden to start for Starc, but a little wayward
oosh! Denly leaves this alone on length, but it jags back and slams into his back thigh... going way over, but that's a lot of movement
beauty! Hangs it outside off stump, holds its line and Denly is beaten playing a defensive prod
similar ball, on fifth stump on a length, and Denly leaves this one alone
beats him again! Brilliant start from Hazlewood, on a length just outside the off stump, looked to punch this through the covers but a little bit of movement away takes it past the edge
a touch fuller this time, on fifth stump, pushed out into the covers and they scuttle through for a single
sharp bouncer, 88mph aimed in at the collarbone. Burns looks to get out the way, but it crashes into his right shoulder and pops out to short leg
on a length, angled across the right-hander and blocked out to the cover fielder
fires this one wider, and Denly lets it go through to Paine
hangs this one miles wide of the off stump, and he leaves it alone
back of a length, sharp, straight, and Denly takes a blow into the shoulder via the glove. Starc greets him with an icy glare! Ducked into that, not a great bit of work against the short ball
half-volley angling across him outside off, punches a drive out to short cover
just full of a length, on leg stump, and unconvincingly defended back down the pitch
full but strays a touch straight, and Burns flicks it off the pads down to long leg for a single
full, pitches on fifth stump, angling into the right-hander, defends firmly into the off side
beats Denly again! Another beauty, length ball outside off, dangles his bat, nips off the seam past the outside edge
full and straight, massive appeal from the Australians... Erasmus doesn't like it. Crashed into the pads, and looked like it might have clipped leg stump after some movement in off the seam
beats Denly yet again, length outside the off stump and he's pushing at it, nips away past the outside edge
guess what? Denly is beaten! Tighter to the off stump, little outswinger which squares him up and beats the outside edge
length outside off from round the wicket, and driven out into the covers for three. Sweetly timed
short ball, very straight and fended to short leg on the bounce, 89mph/143kph. Nicely played
short and wide this time, Denly jumps onto the back foot and punches this through the covers! Well played, not perfectly timed and a little on the up but races away and they come back for a third
short and sprayed down the leg side. Burns gets out the way of it
straight length ball, worked out to mid-on for a single
that's the line to Denly, on fifth stump or thereabouts, and he plays a slightly tentative push out to point for no run
back of a length, Burns shuffles across and works it to the leg side. Crashes into Wade at short leg on the bounce who wears the blow
tight to the stumps, angling across Burns who defends back to the bowler
fired across the left-hander, but too wide and he shoulders arms to it
87mph bumper just outside the off stump, and he ducks underneath it
shortish ball in the channel outside off, Burns tries to drop the hands at the last moment and just about veers inside the line of it. Hazlewood is probing here
yorker on off stump, 88mph/142kph, digs it out into the off side, and Hazlewood has overstepped by an absolute mile! He doesn't seem too happy with the call but Marais has nailed it as usual
slides a length ball across him, Burns thinks about playing a defensive shot but drags his bat inside the line of it
length in the channel outside the off stump, Denly defends with a full face out to mid-on
good pace from Cummins, 88mph/142kph, but a little too wide and Denly lets it go
beaten outside off, you know the drill really! Length ball on fourth or fifth stump, has a needless little poke at it and Cummins beats the outside edge with a hint of movement off the seam
ooft, bursts straight through! Jagged in off the seam through the gap between bat and pad, and Paine makes a good diving stop behind the stumps

gone! Brilliant catch at short leg! Length ball on off stump, Denly gets a little inside edge onto the pad, Wade snatches at it, it rebounds up off the chest and he snaffles the second chance diving forward with one hand! Denly's horror show is finally brought to an end, and Australia go wild in celebration
length ball, defended out to mid-on and they squeeze through for a couple
straight to start, no real turn, and squirted out into the off side
too short this time, Burns rocks back and thumps it through cover for four! Shout of 'catch!' on the way through but flew between two fielders
too short again, goes back and slashes the cut shot to backward point
length ball on fifth stump, looks to cut it away and bottom edges it through Paine's legs for a streaky boundary!
massive turn! Very short, doesn't get up off the surface, doesn't trouble the batsman but that turned alarmingly
slightly too short again, Burns punches elegantly off the back foot through point for a couple
full outside off, and Overton shoulders arms
length in the channel outside off and Overton is beaten, dangles his bat, seams away and flies past the outside edge!
short and straight, 87mph, shuffles across and tucks it to the man at very short fine leg/wide leg gully
full and straight, angled in at the off stump, and nurdled out into the on side for a single
back of a length, fired in at the hip and Overton tucks it away down to long leg for a single. Bit of will-they-won't-they about the run, but they jog through in the end
bouncer from round the wicket, a little wayward down the leg side and Burns ducks underneath it
steams in, fires in a length ball outside the off stump which flies through to Paine with good carry, but doesn't merit a shot as far as Overton is concerned
fires in a bumper this time, aimed at his head. Overton shuffles across and ducks underneath it
length ball on fourth or fifth stump, Overton lunges forward and plays a defensive push back down the pitch
just full of a length on fourth stump or thereabouts, Overton defends firmly back towards the bowler
short outside the off stump, and Overton ducks out the way of it
fierce short ball outside off, 85mph/137kph, and Overton drops out the way of it
88mph, short into the hip, he takes it on the thigh guard and it pops up away from short leg
86mph, short lifter, leaving him off the seam outside off, he drops the hands and lets it pass
89mph, back of a length outside off, he is happy to raise the bat and leave it alone
90mph, good length, outside off, he gets a thick edge that bounces to gully. Nice soft hands from Burns
Big LBW appeal, not out is the call. No review. It was too high. Good length, 90mph, on leg, he shuffled across and was hit high on the pad. Hawkeye had it going over leg
back of a length on off, he's standing up in the crease and defending
87mph, fourth stump, good length, it climbs and Overton defends off the splice of the bat
87mph, fuller outside off, nicely pushed on the front foot through cover. Good positive stroke and the runs are greeted with a roar

edged and straight to Smith at second slip! Brilliant bowling. The perfect length angled in, fourth stump line, it hit the seam and straightened, caught the edge as he prodded forward, it flew at pace, waist high to Smith who pouched it very comfortably
87mph, back of a length on off, he's back and getting a thick inside edge that goes safely behind square
cracking bouncer, he drops his knees and sways under it
beaten by an 88mph good length ball that nips across him as he defends from the crease
89mph, length ball on leg stump, he's back and working this awkwardly but effectively to fine leg
fend and miss. Poor stroke. This was back of a length wide of off and leaving him, no need to play. He pushed away from the body but missed it
88mph, fuller, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot but he's deep in the crease
87mph, cracking bouncer, he drops the knees and ducks under it
87mph, fuller angled into off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
