glorious cover drive! 89mph but over-pitched, he leaned forward with balance and timing and stroked it wide of mid off for four. Superb shot
play and miss driving dangerously outside off. It was full and tempting but his feet weren't quite there. Just missed the edge
tight leave but a good one. 88mph, good length, nipping back but just wide and high of off stump
another tight leave to an 89mph, good length ball nipping back off the seam
87mph, very full into off, he drives with a slight head fall, picks out mid on

nice controlled drive this time and they run four! It was 88mph, over-pitched, he got a good stride forward and placed it through cover with control. It went to the longest boundary and a huge chase for Wade. He got there but they ran four
beaten again by a leg cutter that shoots low! Good length, he's caught on the crease, it nips away and dies short of Paine
89mph, beaten, good length outside off, nipping a touch away as he plays down the wrong line
87mph, shorter length, nipping in, he shuffles across and gets taken on the thigh guard
88mph, full, very full, he drops the bat down and bunts it to point
86mph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and defending with the full face
play and miss driving at a wide outswinger on the up. It flew past the edge. Big stroke in these conditions
beaten by a cracker! 89mph on the money, good length, fourth stump, shaping late, beats the edge again
86mph, fifth stump line, hint of nip back but Root leaves it comfortably
86mph, good length angled into the top of off, he's defending half forward
87mph, good length, fourth stump, he defends half forward pushing it to point
guided nicely through third man. Nice controlled shot. Back of a length outside off, he was back on his toes, opening the face of the vertical bat and letting it run through the vacant wide gully
back of a length, nipping back sharply and taking him on the thigh guard but too high and the LBW shout is aborted quickly
88mph bouncer wide of off though and Root doesn't need to do anything but watch it pass
back of a length on middle, 88mph, he's back and defending comfortably into the leg side
wide full toss and placed through point. That was junk and Burns just guided it away forward of point
88mph full on leg stump, he clips this away off his toes behind square, wide of fine leg for a couple
88mph low full toss, outside off, he jams the bat down to defend to point
89mph, shorter on the hip, he's back and tucking this behind square for a couple
89mph, short lifter outside off, he drops the gloves under it and sways away to let it go
85mph, fuller on off, again Root's head drops to the off side a touch as he pushes this to mid on
88mph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
85mph, good length, a touch of nip away wide, Root played and then withdrew the bat just in time
angled down leg, it clips the pad and bounces just short of Pain who can't collect on the half volley and they get an extra
87mph, back of a length, on off, he stands tall and defends with the full face
86mph, swinging down leg prodigiously, Paine dives and does well to knock it down
86mph, fuller outside off, he leans forward and pushes without conviction to mid off
85mph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
back of a length, nipping back and he's back and defending off a thick inside edge onto pad
87mph, good length, nipping away he plays and misses trying to defend
87mph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending well with the full face
88mph, good length, angled into the top of off, he defends from the crease
tossed up on off, some spin, he defends from the crease
shorter length, 57mph, he's back and pushing it to backward point
drifting to leg, and spinning, he defends with a slight leading edge short of silly point
fuller on off, he's leaning out and smothering the spin nicely
quicker and sliding onto off, he's back and jamming the bat down late to knock it to point
sweeping from off stump, no timing but got enough of it to place it behind square
88mph, good length but angled well wide of off, he leaves it easily
88mph, into the ribs, he awkwardly knocks it down but he played it well enough
85mph, short ball, lifting and leaving him, he drops the hands well inside the line
another quick short ball, over off, he drops the hands and sways inside nicely
88mph, back of a length on off, he defends from the crease, dropping the bat on it to get it to point
87mph brute that gets him on the gloves. He knocked it down though. That climbed from back of a length and reared at him. He punched it down off the gloves into the off side.
full and wide of off but sharp turn as Root leaves
very wide and short, he's back and cutting but straight to backward point
shorter length but closer to off, spinning and bouncing, he's back and punching but with no timing to beat cover
tossed up outside off, he leans forward and smothers the spin
quicker, length ball, he's back and covering up in defence
looped up outside off, he stretches out and defends
86mph, short ball climbing outside off, he shaped to play and then just dropped his hands inside it
over steps, and called, a bouncer, way too high over his head
88mph, short ball outside off, angled across, he drops the hands inside again
86mph, shorter down leg, he shuffles across to glance but can't make contact
good length, 90mph, bounces and takes him on the thigh guard as he tries to work to leg
87mph, searing bumper, he ducks early and well
87mph another bouncer and again it's high and through to Paine
tossed up outside off, he reaches out to defend
looped up outside off, he steps out to defend with ease
52mph, he goes back to a good length that spins sharply and he defends on the move
good length, spinning quickly, he defends from the crease
skipping down early, he doesn't get to the pitch and it hits the pad as he tries to whip
shorter and too straight, he's back and working this past short leg into a gap
86mph, back of a length wide of off, nipping away, he withdraws the bat inside the line
angled down leg and it comes off the thigh guard and runs fine. Poor delivery and they get runs for it
86mph, good length, fifth stump line, Root is happy to leave
clipped beautifully off the pads through square! Too full and straight on leg stump, Root elegantly clipped it forward of square
87mph, good length, top of off, he defends off the outside half of the bat and it runs into the gully
88mph, back of a length on off, he stands up on his toes and defends with the full face
57mph, drifting down leg, he clips this neatly but straight to forward square
tossed up on middle and leg, he pushes firmly to mid on
fractionally short and wide, he's back and cracking a cut hard to deep point
glanced fine with the sharp turn. Well played. He went deep in his crease, it spun sharply but down leg, he waited and tickled it fine
tossed up, outside off, he leans out and gets a thick inside edge which bounces to short leg
looped up outside off, he reaches out and drops the bat on the ball in defence
84mph, good length, top of off, he is half forward getting a thick inside edge onto body
hooked fine but not in control! A short ball aimed at the front shoulder, he got inside and hooked off the top edge but it flew fine of fine leg, one bounce four
85mph, back of a length on middle, he stands tall and defends with the full face
85mph, short ball flying down leg, he gets inside the line and withdraws his hands wisely. That took off
83mph, good length well wide of off and he's happy to leave
85mph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending with an open face to gully
sharp turn, a little inside edge onto pad but it bounces well clear of short leg
flatter and he's back to defend this time
tuning sharply down leg, Paine doesn't glove it cleanly but there's no bye due to short fine
again sharp turn down leg and Paine takes this neatly
tossed up on off, he's forward and defending
good length turning miles from outside off, he's caught on the crease and hit high the thigh. Sharp turn and bounce there. Lyon will love that
back of a length on off, 86mph, he's back and defending easily
86mph, sharp bouncer, off stump line, he ducks under it well
86mph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease with soft hands
83mph, shorter ball wide of off, he square drives off the back foot, playing away from his body but picks out point
83mph, short ball down leg, he went to glance it but withdrew the gloves. Wasn't far away from touching it
83mph, short on the hip, he clips this away with control to fine leg
shorter and wide of off, he's back and cutting firmly to deep point
slightly short, he pulls from the stumps, roping it to short fine leg. Risky shot
tossed up higher, he pushes a drive to mid off
tossed up outside off, he whips with the spin to midwicket
tossed up, he whips off the inside edge onto his boot and it rolls away into the off side
looped up, outside off, he stretches out and defends
back of a length angling across him, punched out to cover off the back foot and they scamper through for a couple
bumper, fired down leg at 85mph/137kph, Burns ducks underneath it
back of a length in the channel outside off, Burns fends at it and draws his bat inside it at the last moment
just full of a length on off stump or just outside, defended into the off side
short and straight, in Burns' eyeline. He ducks into it a bit, and it flicks his right shoulder on the way through
full on leg stump, clipped off his pads through square leg. Not timed, but they come back for three, and that brings up the fifty partnership from 19.3 overs
a bit of flight, very straight and nudged out to mid-on
on with the arm, fired in towards leg stump at 57mph and worked away through backward square for one
full outside the off stump, Root looks to play a little dinky paddle sweep and only succeeds in toeing it into his pad
big inside edge looking to drive this outside off, and it flies between his back leg and the stumps down to fine leg
crablike defensive shot off the back foot to a length ball outside off
good turn from a length, gets back and across and defends
length outside off, 86mph/138kph, leans on a drive through the covers for a couple. Not perfectly timed
tight to the stumps, and fires a wild 88mph/142kph bouncer way down the leg side
tight on the crease again, back of a length on fourth or fifth stump and plays a back-foot punch with high hands through point for four! Lovely shot
back of a length, shuffles across and tucks this down to fine leg. They run well, these two, and they scuttle back for a couple
back of a length ball, on fourth stump, and Burns squeezes this out through the gully for four! Not fully in control, but played late with open hands. Burns brings up his 50, and a Cowan to boot.
sharp bouncer, 89mph/143kph, and Burns ducks underneath it
length outside off, good turn and Root knocks it into the leg side defensively
length ball, big turn past the leg stump and it flicks Root's thigh pad on the way through
slightly fuller outside off, Root gets low to sweep, connects with it well but the legside sweeper cuts it off
length ball, good turn again, and tucked out to square leg
tossed up, full outside the off stump, and dabbed out to cover lunging forward for a single
length outside off, punched out to cover for one off the back foot
tight to the stumps again, back of a length on fourth stump and punched out to backward point off the back foot. Burns has done well against Starc so far, picking off anything short or wide
length ball, strays too straight and flicked off the pads for four
length on off stump, Root defends back to the bowler off the back foot
too straight again, length on the pads and Root clips out to midwicket for three. That brings up the 100 for England, to loud cheers from the temporary stand
very short bouncer, 89mph/143kph, and Burns ducks underneath it
short outside off the time, Burns drops the hands and sways inside it with consummate ease
length ball, spinning in towards off stump, and nudged out to square leg
oooh nearly! Length outside off, Root looks to play a late dab down to third man, inside edges it and it flies away to fine leg for four!
straighter this time, Root goes back and works it down to fine leg, Burns sets off and is sent back. Lyon gathers the throw at the non-striker's end to loud cheers from the crowd!
length ball, very straight, and worked out to square leg
length outside off, sweeps it to short fine leg
length ball outside off, not much spin this time and punched into the covers off the back foot
straight length ball, worked out to midwicket
low full toss outside the off stump, squeezed out towards point for a scrambled single
back of a length ball on leg stump, defended out to short midwicket
slightly full of a length and fired down the leg side, smart take by Paine
full on leg stump, 89mph/143kph, and worked out ever so slightly uppishly towards straight midwicket, who fields well
double bluff, length ball on fourth stump, and punched back to the bowler off the back foot
length outside off, Root lunges forward and defends
length outside off, good turn into the right-hander, pushed out to cover and they take a sharp single
wide on the crease, good turn on a length, punched out to backward point
a toucher fuller and a touch straighter, pushed out into the covers on the front foot
full and straight, goes on with the angle from round the wicket, and Burns defends
length ball, whipped out to mid-on but there's no run
awkward length just outside the off stump, and Root defends to cover
full on fourth stump, 89mph/143kph, driven straight to mid-on
length ball fired in just outside off, pushed away into the off side

ooh, right in the dee-eye-see-kay! Tight to the stumps, Starc hits a tough length and Root, jumping in his crease, is crunched where it hurts and hits the deck. Takes a minute or two for a breather, and looks like he'll be alright
full outside off, hint of movement away and left alone
length angling across him, on fourth or fifth stump, and punched out to cover point
straight, length ball, worked out to midwicket
length outside off, down at 80mph/129kph, and skewed into the leg side off a slight inside edge
straight length ball, punched out to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, and dropped out into the off side
fuller, but a bit wayward, and clipped off his pads down to long leg. Mighty Marnus misfields, and they come back for a second
short and wide down the leg side, Burns plays a pull but misses it completely as it flies through to T-Paine
length outside off, Root plays a strange late dab off the back foot and bottom edges it down into the cordon on the bounce
length ball angled across the right-hander, Root drops back in the crease and runs it down to third man. Lyon gives chase and pulls out the superhero dive, but can't quite reach it. Four!
straight, length ball, defended back to the bowler on the back foot
fired in on the pads, and clipped down to long leg
full and pretty straight, Burns looks to shovel it into the leg side but it flicks the pad. Strangled appeal from Starc, but it looked like it was clipping leg stump at best
89mph/143kph, slightly full of a length on off stump. Burns gets front on, defends to mid-on and shimmies down the pitch after it
awkward line and length, on fourth or fifth stump, and dabbed out to backward point
a touch wider and a hint of movement away off the surface, played down to third man off the back foot and well fielded by the diving Harris
length on fourth stump angling in, Root defends
hangs an outswinger outside the off stump, decent movement, but he shoulders arms
length just outside off, punched away off the back foot
length ball on off stump, inside edged down to fine leg
length ball, angling in, and worked out to long leg as the bat face closes in his hands
back of a length outside off, 83mph, and doesn't really get up off the pitch. Burns drops the hands and gets inside the line of it
awkward, straight ball on a length at 85mph/137kph, nips back in and Burns inside edges onto the thigh pad
angling across Burns on a length, prodded out into the covers for no run
bouncer outside the leg stump, Burns ducks underneath it
slightly full of a length, up at 88mph/142kph, and prodded defensively out towards mid-off for no run. Decent first over of the new Cummins spell
just full of a length on fourth stump, and Root defends into the off side on the front foot
straight length ball, Root sits back in his crease and defends back to the bowler
length ball down the leg side, doesn't get up off the pitch and dribbles through to Paine
back of a length and again doesn't get up off the pitch at all, Root jams his bat down on it in defence
shorter outside off, and Root launches into this off the back foot, crunching it through square leg for four! Great shot
very full on off stump, digs it out towards mid-on. 87mph/140kph
ooh ripper, sharp bumper on off stump, rides the bounce and squirts off the glove into the ground
short again, a little wayward this time down the leg side, 87mph/142kph, and Burns shoulders arms right at the last moment
fired across the leftie, just full of a length at 89mph/143kph, and shoulders arms to it
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and defends
length on off stump, clipped out into the leg side for one. They briefly consider coming back for two, but sensibly think better of it
length ball hung outside the off stump, holds its line and Root shoulders arms
ooh, good turn first up and he's beaten. Slightly full of a length, defensive prod and flies past the bat
length outside off, Burns rocks back and whacks this out to the cover sweeper for a couple
full and straight, lurches forward to defend with a straight bat
wide on the crease, good revs from Lyon but a bit of natural variation and it doesn't spin much, Burns punches back to him
a touch too straight, Burns works into the leg side on the defensive
drops back, looking to whack this out to point, but fielded on the bounce and there's no run
length ball just outside the off stump, just short of 90mph/145mph, and Root has a little poke at it before withdrawing his bat late in the piece
angled into the right-hander, and worked out to mid-on off the back foot
length ball, plays it late under the eyes into the off side, soft hands so doesn't go far at all and there's no run
beaten outside off! Hung outside the off stump at 90mph/145kph, holds it line and beats Root's outside edge. Good little spell from Cummins, this
beats him again! Same pace, length ball on fifth stump or thereabouts, Root looks to defend but there's a hint of nibble away and it does him all ends up
a fraction wider from Cummins, and wide enough to let it go
54mph, tossed up, on middle, he leans out and defends
tossed up on off, 53mph, he steps out and defends on the front foot
fuller on middle, he whips against the turn to mid on
short and wide, a drag down, he stands up and slaps a cut forward of cover! Easy pickings. He placed it well
drifting to leg, he is forward and defending
short and wide again, he is back and cutting to deep point
86mph, good length, angled wide of off and he leaves this alone
88mph, bouncer, over leg, he ducks under it late but well enough
84mph, back of a length angled wide of off, he leaves again
beaten by a cracker! 86mph, good length, pitching on leg, and jagging sharply past the edge outside off! Wow that went a mile
86mph, angled across the left hander, fifth stump line, he plays inside the line deliberately
84mph, bouncer, it comes off slower and he ducks under it easily
tossed up fuller, he is forward and turning it with the spin to short leg
spinning down leg, he doesn't try to glance it, taken by Paine
he sweeps from outside off, but mistimes it, roping it to short fine leg
shorter and well wide, he's back and waiting and dabbing a late cut fine but only gets a single
sharp spin beating the edge! This pitched on off and spun and bounced past the edge.
flatter on off, he's back and punching this to cover
88mph, good length angled into leg, he clips this behind square for a single
86mph, good length, middle and leg line, he is in behind it and defending with the full face
84mph, bouncer, high over leg stump, he ducks under it
89mph, back of a length, angled into off, he's tucking this around the corner with the angle to fine leg
88mph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending with soft hands running it to slip on the bounce
beaten again, 90mph, fuller wide of off, he was half forward prodding, but didn't get fair enough out to nick it
good length, outside off, he's back and punching this to backward point
shorter and wider, he's back and cracking a cut to deep point
good length, outside off, he's back and dabbing it trying to beat slip but Smith dives and saves it
fuller on middle, he's right back and tucking it past short leg to move to 50. He's played well. He loves Old Trafford
good length, some bounce and spin, he's forced to check his shot on the back foot and defend it to backward point
fuller on middle, he whips this against the turn to mid on
88mph, good length, fourth stump line, he's forward and defending in a textbook fashion
89mph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends tentatively into the off side
drives off a thickish outside edge through backward point! It was very full and wide, inviting the drive, he didn't intend to get it behind point but he controlled the stroke well and timed it well
good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot again

edged between Paine and Warner! Neither moved! Full and late swing away, he drives gets an edge that flies between Paine and Warner who were both unmoved looking at each other! That was the chance. It flew but they both had to go
fuller again outside off, he defends on the front foot, half forward
drifting into middle, he is forward and working this to midwicket
sweeps hard infront of square! This was full on off, he was down early to hammer it forward of square
looped up, outside off, he presses forward and pushes off an open face to point
beaten by sharp spin, prodding from the crease outside off. This really gripped and bounced
fired in quicker and straighter, he defends
flatter on off, he's defending from the crease

An LBW appeal but he was hit high and outside the line. Australia review! Crazy review this. Back of a length leg cutter. He was squared up, it hits him outside the line. Height was OK but it was missing off. Terrible review
88mph, back of a length wide of off, he pushes from the crease behind point
edged past second slip! No third slip in. This was another good length leg cutter, he prodded away from his body, got a thick edge, it might not have carried anyway but no one was there
spar and miss at one that climbs outside off! That took off
sharp short ball, 87mph, he cops this on the gloves! He had no idea about that! Completely lost it and took his eyes off it as he fended
good length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone
short and wide, he's back and cutting through backward point to the sweeper
angled down leg, he glances fine but Warner makes a good diving save at short fine leg
tossed up outside off, he strides out and defends with the full face
angled down leg, he tucks this around the corner but straight to Warner again
shorter length, he's down on one knee and pulling behind square, finding the gap, Head has a long chase on the fence and makes a diving stop
fuller on leg, he's back again, tucking this to short fine
short ball angled into the ribs, he steps inside the line and gets his hands high and out of the way to let it go
nearly a run out! Burns punched off the back foot to Head at mid off and took him on and Burns was cooked if Head hit! He just missed! Wow.
good length outside off, he's in behind it pushing this to mid off
89mph, good length, nipping in off the seam, Root pushes and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
full on leg stump, he clips this away neatly forward of square and Starc has to come around from deep backward square to cut it off
fends off the shoulder off the bat and it drops short of point! This climbed from a length, he fended at it, it came off the shoulder of the bat but didn't carry far enough to reach a fielder
tossed up outside off, he's forward and prodding in defence
a slight leading edge trying to work to leg from outside off
shorter length, on leg, he's back and glancing this to short fine
tossed higher outside off, he yorks himself initially thinking to sweep, jamming it back to Lyon
shorter length, he's down on one knee to pull to deep square
shorter length, wide of off, he cuts to cover but can't pick the gap
a waft and miss wide of off! Poor stroke. Feet anchored, just waving at a non-committal cut shot
good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending confidently
beaten again. Superb leg cutter at 87mph, left him and climbed from outside off.
85mph, searing inswinger, he does well to get the bat down and defend, knocking it down on the leg side and Burns calls him through
short ball into the ribs, 89mph, he fends it down short of short leg
88mph cracking bouncer. He was ducking early and took his eyes off it
flighted outside off, he's reaching out and working this behind square with his wrists
shorter length, he's back and cramped on the cut
flatter outside off, he's back and covering off in defence
tossed up on off, he stretches forward and defends covering the spin
shorter length, he tries to pull but mistimes it to midwicket
nice shape and flight wide of off, he leaves watchfully as it spins back
88mph, good length, fourth stump line, he's defending from the crease, pushing into the off side
88mph, bouncer, outside, Burns ducked out of instinct, taking his eyes off it
86mph, short ball, high over Burns' head as he ducks
88mph, back of a length on off, he defends from the crease
good length, 87mph, on middle, he tucks this behind square neatly to rotate the strike
87mph, back of a length, top of off, he's back and defending
shorter length, he's back and working this to mid on
top edged sweep floats high but safe behind square! Some extra bounce extracts the top edge but it lands safe with no short fine leg in
tossed up outside off, he stretches out and defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and pulling from off stump to deep square
short and wide, he's back and cutting to deep point
shorter length, he's back, deep and tucking this to forward square
82mph, shorter length wide of off, he's back and defending, knocking this down into the off side
86mph, good length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending again
84mph, back of a length, he pushes a defensive stroke off the back foot to gully
good length, top of off, he's defending from the crease to cover
85mph, good length, hint of shape away but it was tight to off, he is squared up but he defends well
fuller on off, he is forward and pushing firmly back to the bowler
tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and pushing this to cover with ease
nearly a catch at cover! He hammered a cut to cover, Wade dives to his right and it just drops short and bursts through his hands
shorter on middle, he's back and tucking it around the corner
slower outside off, he's back and across and defending, with soft hands
pushed through wide of off, he steps across to leave, wary of sharp turn
play and miss trying to defend away from his body. It was angled across and shaping further away but no edge

edged and taken at second slip! Finally some reward! Wobbling seam, pitching on off, on a good length, it nipped away, he defends from the crease, it catches a thick edge and flies knee high to Smith who claims the sharp chance to his left. Good bowling and good catching
fuller inswinger, he's forward and getting a thick inside edge onto pad. There was a gap there and it could have sneaked through
excellent length, top of off, he pushes hard and defends out infront of his pad towards mid on
back of a length, 84mph, fifth stump line, he leaves on length
85mph, good length, top of off,  he pushes awkwardly out infront of his pad to mid off
tossed up on off, he's back and working this around the corner
shorter length, he's back and pulling to deep backward square
lovely flight and loop outside off, it spins sharply past the inside edge and hits the thigh guard
tossed up outside off, he pushes away from his body to point
tossed up outside off, he's back and defending on top of the bounce
shorter length, he gives room to cut but it's spinning and bouncing sharply and he's forced to defend
slightly full of a length outside the off stump, Root plays it late under his eyes, dabbing out to the off side, and they scuttle through for a single
ooh, that's the line to Roy, just in and around fourth stump. He defends with hard hands, and it flies away into the off side
length ball on fifth stump, Roy leaves it alone on length
bosh! Roy crunches a checked drive through the covers, which races away to the right of the man at short cover. Like watching the first over of the powerplay!
strays a little too straight, and Roy clips it off his leg stump out to long leg. Starc fields well, but they come back for a comfortable third
got 'im! Trapped in front, length ball, nips back off the seam and doesn't get up much off the pitch, hits Root flush on the pad and that looked stone dead. Root doesn't review, and off he trudges
ooh, pitches on a length and spins in sharply, Roy goes back and across, and plays with hard hands, gets a little inside edge into the body
length outside off, and defended into the on side
a touch shorter outside off, Roy rocks back and crunches this through cover point for four to move into double figures!
bit of bounce outside the off stump, whipped into the leg side for a jogged single
natural variation as this goes straight on with the arm, Stokes defends into the leg side
slightly fuller and draws an edge! But soft enough hands for it to bounce a few inches short of Labuschagne in the cordon
length ball angling in towards off stump, Roy defends back down the pitch
hangs a length ball outside the off stump, hint of movement away, Roy has a nibble at it and is beaten
a touch fuller on fourth stump, sumptuously driven out towards mid-off but there's a fielder there
full and straight on the pads, and worked out to straight midwicket on the half-volley for a couple
hangs a length ball outside off at 86mph/138kph, little hint of inswing but shoulders arms
length ball on leg stump, tickled out into the leg side for one off the pad
floated up on off stump, Roy whacks this out to long-on for a straightforward single
goes on with the angle from round the wicket, flicked off the pad square of the wicket
full and tossed up outside off, driven out into the covers for three, nicely timed. Lyon fumbles the return throw at the non-striker's end to jeers from the crowd!
ooh beaten! Length ball, Stokes doesn't know whether to go forward or back and his crablike defensive shot is beaten
a little slower and shorter, allowing the left-hander to rock back and punch one out into the covers
length outside off, Roy defends firmly
fired across him on a length, shoulders arms as it flies through to Paine
short, pitched outside the leg stump and rears up off the pitch. Stokes fends it off his shoulder and gloves this down to fine leg
83mph, length ball outside the off stump, and Roy blocks this out to cover
length ball outside off, Roy has a wild swing at it, looking to pull through midwicket, and misses it completely. Dumb cricket
length ball on fourth or fifth stump, 85mph/137kph, and defended out to cover
length ball, bit of movement in towards the pad, and strikes him on the bottom of the thigh pad. Half an appeal from the bowler, but that looked like it was high and flying down leg
great ball! And a delayed appeal... they think about reviewing, but decide against. Length ball, pitched on off stump, Stokes tried to defend it out to mid-on and missed it
full ball, Stokes defends
fires in a yorker towards leg stump, defends back down the pitch
length ball, straightens a touch, Stokes defends off the back foot and it squirts out towards third man off the outside edge
length ball on leg stump, bit of a freebie which Stokes wristily works out to long leg for a couple
full and straight, Stokes lunges forward and defends with a straight bat
length ball, jags in and strikes Roy on the back thigh. Stifled appeal, but flying over
slightly full of a length, angled in towards off stump and he defends
back of a length outside the off stump, punched sweetly off the back foot through the covers for four! Lovely shot

BOWLED 'IM! Jason Roy's middle stump goes flying back and Hazlewood roars in celebration. See ya later! Great ball, nip-backer that moves late off the seam, bursts through Roy's fairly nothing-y defensive prod and sends him back on his way. Crucial breakthrough with the new ball approaching, Hazlewood and Australia on a roll
short ball outside the off stump to start, and Bairstow ducks underneath it
full on fourth stump, Bairstow defends and it squirts away through third man for a couple off the edge
punched off the back foot through cover, Head is stretched on the rope, they push for two and get there to bring up 200
rocks back in the crease, defended out to point off the back foot
full and straight, Stokes lunges forward on the defensive
full and straight, defended with bat and pad together out to cover
slightly full of a length, bit of grip, and Stokes blocks it
full on off stump, hint of turn, Stokes meets it with a full bat
good length outside off, left alone
full and straight, squeezed behind square on the leg side off a thick inside edge
nice delivery, back of a length at off stump, angled across and left alone
fuller this time, a hint of wobble, a tight but well-judged leave from Stokes
a short delivery and that's superbly pulled away, rib-cage height and he got over the top it nicely, finding the gap between fine leg and deep square
a full delivery to end the over, 86mph/138kph, left alone
over the wicket, length ball at off stump, defended on the back foot
fuller, starts outside off, hint of turn, Bairstow plays forward
a little wider outside off, Bairstow goes across and defends
starts a touch too straight and spins down the leg side, nice bounce though
goes back in the crease and turns this from off stump behind square...certainly turning nicely
fraction shorter, whipped off the pads to deep square
beaten! Excellent delivery, on a good length outside, straightens a hint and scoots past Bairstow's edge
back of a length outside off, 87mph/140kph, left alone and carries on the rise to Paine
full and straight, clipped strongly but mid-on is able to cut it off
good length outside off, left alone
onto the front foot and defends a length ball to cover
keeps it on a good length outside off, 87mph/140kph, defended to the off side...very tight, again, from Cummins
round the wicket, full outside off, nice spin away and left alone
a little shorter on off stump, defended on the back foot
plays back and waits for this to turn, pushes with an open face to point
fuller, outside off, left alone as it spins
a shorter delivery is driven square off the back foot to deep point
big appeal for lbw! Bairstow kicking this away outside off, Erasmus shakes his head and Paine doesn't review...bounce going against Lyon
length ball outside off, through to the keeper
play and a miss! Stokes gets drawn into this one, which is fuller and a touch wider, almost finds the edge
gets on the pads this time, tucked to fine leg
short of a length outside off, left alone...88mph/141kph
full at the stumps, clipped into the on side and mid-on (Hazlewood) lets it through as he slides...a few bonus runs
back of a length outside off, jabbed to the covers
full outside off, Bairstow gets forward and shovels it to the on side and it beats Lyon to reach long-on
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
clipped off the pads to square leg
full at the stumps, touch more air this time, driven to mid-off
plays back to a slightly shorter, straighter delivery and pushes to the on side
gets well forward with bat in front of pad, defends
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, defended to point
back of a length outside off, hint of shape back into Bairstow as he leaves it alone...that will encourage Starc
full at off stump, again it offers to come back at the right hander, driven to mid-off
good length outside off, through to Paine with a touch of swing
back of a length, straighter, takes his bottom hand off the bat and the ball rolls to the on side
nicely bowled, gets it full at middle and off, straightens a touch on Stokes as he defends to mid-off...tidy start from Starc
an appeal for lbw straightaway as this nips back from a good length, takes Bairstow reasonably high so that helps save him with the new-ball bounce
well bowled! He's found the spot immediately, touch fuller at off stump, Bairstow jabs the bat down somewhat hurriedly
good response from Bairstow as he punches a full delivery straight back past Hazlewood's left hand, and straight of mid-off
that's a pretty tight leave as it nips back from a good length, travels over off stump
touch of extra bounce from short of a length, 83mph/133kph, Bairstow takes his bottom hand off the bat
good length at off stump, hits the bat hard as it's defended to the off side
length ball at the stumps, 87mph/140kph, defended to midwicket
worked off the stumps to the man at a catching midwicket
short of a length outside off, a pull-turned-swat from Stokes as he sends it well in front of square
inside edge flies over the stumps, no luck for Starc, Stokes gets away with it...movement off the seam

dropped, but a very tough, low chance in Starc's followthrough as Stokes bunts a full delivery straight back down the pitch. Starc couldn't quite get down to his right. Fingertips. Would have been a blinder
an attempted yorker, perhaps, as it was very full at the stumps, clipped to mid-on
over the wicket, full at the stumps, defended
well bowled! Full outside off, left alone and it just offers to nip back...Paine moves to his left to collect
beaten! That's a ripper from Hazlewood, good length at middle and off, nips back and zips past the inside edge. Too good
fraction shorter, back of a length outside off, pushed from the back foot to the covers
full at middle and leg, clipped firmly but midwicket dives to cut off
a bouncer, over middle and leg, he ducks underneath
full at off stump, 88mph/141kph, driven off the cue end to mid-on
poor delivery, dragged down short and wide outside off, Bairstow sends it through the big gap at cover with an almost horizontal bat
better delivery, full outside off, left alone
full, wide outside off, a tempter for Bairstow to drive but he leaves it alone

through him! That could change things for Starc. Trademark dismissal. Good length delivery, swings back at Bairstow who goes for the drive and leaves a big gap. Loose shot against the new ball, but excellent bowling
short, wide outside off, left alone...a sighter for Buttler
full at middle and off, defended
some late swing, neatly works a straight delivery into the leg side
beaten by a beauty on off stump which nips away
and now this one nips back the other way from a good length, beats the inside edge and hammers into Buttler
gets forward to a full delivery outside off, defends with an open face to backward point
solidly defended to the off side
back of a length at off stump, 86mph/138kph, defended to midwicket
pulls the bat inside the line of a delivery wider outside off
full at middle, driven nicely to mid-on
another great-looking on drive from Stokes which mid-on does very well to cut off
a bouncer which he ducks underneath
back of a length at off stump, dropped to the off side and he sets off for a single...Stokes sends him back. These two had a run out at Headingley! All safe this time
tight line and length just outside off stump, Stokes leaves it alone on length
a touch fuller on off stump, Stokes drives out to mid-on
a bit shorter, Stokes pulls hard, top edges it by it soars up over the keeper's head and races away! Didn't get all of that by any means but put enough into the shot to ensure it would fall safely
length ball, pitches outside leg, looks to work it into the leg side, and it tickles the pad before skimming away down past Paine's diving right hand!
length ball angling across Stokes, pitches on middle, reaches him on off, and he defends back down the pitch
length ball on off stump or just outside, Stokes defends
full, a fraction outside his off stump, Buttler drives slightly uppishly, he doesn't get all of it, but it flies away past Wade's right hand at mid-off
slightly back of a length, 87mph, Buttler fends it into the leg side for a jogged single

got 'im! Starc gets Stokes with a ripper, a bit of nibble away off the seam from over the wicket on a length, Stokes nibbles at it and his outside edge is well held by Smith at second slip! Massive, massive breakthrough for Australia

back of a length, slightly too straight, Archer fends this away square of the wicket behind short leg, he jogs down to the far end, there's a shy at the stumps and it would have been out with a direct hit!
strays slightly too full, bit of a half-volley just outside the off stump and Buttler drives sumptuously through cover for four
hangs one slightly too wide of the off stump, Buttler leaves it alone
full of a length outside the off stump, Archer has a little nibble at this and is beaten. Didn't get up much off the surface at all, hints of variable bounce
length ball, on fourth stump, jams the bat down on the defensive shot
short outswinger, lets it go outside the off stump
length on fourth stump, defends out into the off stump
tight to the stumps, short ball that flies down the leg side and Archer lets it go
short ball, 85mph/137kph, but too wide and Archer drops the hands and leaves it alone
short outside off, Buttler looks to punch it through the covers but doesn't get much of a connection
snorter! Inswinger, pitches on or around fourth stump, nips back on the surface, beats Buttler's drive and is not far at all from hitting the top of off
straighter this time on a length, 88mph/142kph, Buttler defends at it squirts away past second slip off the shoulder of the bat. They come back for a couple and that brings up 250 for England
fires a length ball across the right-hander, Buttler shoulders arms
length outside off, Buttler shuffles across and leaves it alone
yorker length outside the off stump, bounces strangely off the crease and skews away via Paine down for byes!
length outside off, big turn and deflects off Archer's thigh pad down towards short leg
biiig turn from outside off, again squeezes away off Archer's thigh pad
good turn again, length outside off, knocks it down into the ground in front of short leg
again good turn from outside the off stump, traps him on the pad but always sliding down leg despite Paine's appeal
shorter and wider, not so much turn, Archer looks to clonk it through cover and misses it
fuller and straighter, tighter to the off stump, Archer defends
full and a touch straight, knocked out on the half-volley to that man Wade at midwicket who fumbles, but not badly enough for them to come back for a second. And Cummins has overstepped.
fires a very wayward bouncer down the leg side, which Archer ducks underneath
length ball angled in towards off stump, defended out into the covers
fuller on fourth or fifth stump, driven out into the off side but the man at cover fields well

outswinger, just back of a length outside off, Archer has a nothing-y waft at it and misses it again. Paine appeals, but isn't sufficiently convinced to send it upstairs. Don't think he was anywhere near it... as UltraEdge now confirms
length ball, 85mph/137kph angled in at off stump, defended on the front foot

edged, and gone! This is a pretty poor shot, really. Length ball, just outside the off stump, which gets up well of the surface and nips away a touch, and his airy waft only succeeds in edging it behind. England in trouble!
full outside off, Buttler looks to work it out to midwicket but finds the fielder
tossed up outside off, a fraction full and Buttler whacks a drive through extra cover for four! The first sign that he might free his arms here

length outside off, good turn, Buttler isn't playing a shot and is struck on the pad. They think about the appeal, and do indeed review it with one second left on the timer. Looked a touch high maybe? Yep, juuust going over the off stump. Not an awful review though
length ball, pitches outside off and turning it, Buttler calmly tickles it around the corner down to fine leg for another boundary!
half-volley length outside off, knocked out to mid-on
massive turn from outside off past the leg stump, Buttler ends up leaving it alone which means Broad will be on strike
back of a length ball on off stump, Broad jumps back in defence
back of a length, pushing Broad back and he defends from deep in his crease
short again, and again Broad jumps back deep into the crease, and defends firmly
very sharp bouncer, 86mph/138kph, good bounce off the pitch which means it flies over Broad's head and beats Paine on its way through! Called wides, probably fair
short ball down the leg side, Broad gets out the way and it flies through to Paine
there's the full one, jams his bat down on it and it squirts out to short point but they steal a quick single!
bluff from Cummins, sends three out on the hook but fires one in full just outside off and Buttler drives through cover for four! Glorious shot
pretty full outside the off stump, Broad prods forward, it squeezes away to backward point off the outside edge and they scuttle through for a single
fullish outside off and turning in, Buttler works it down to fine leg for a single
length ball, pitches just outside off and turns appreciably. Punched out to cover point off the back foot
big turn from outside off, Broad lets it go
length outside off, again big turn, Broad leaves it alone again
a touch fuller and straighter, Broad lunges forward and is beaten
back of a length on fifth stump, Buttler punches out to mid-off on the back foot
yorker, full and straight at 85mph/137kph, dug out well
strays a touch short, Buttler works through midwicket off the hip
sharp short ball at Broad, 87mph/140kph, but he gets out the way of it
short ball, angled in at the body, and Broad wears it on the back. Called up for overstepping this time
short ball sliding across him, head-high, and Broad just about sways inside the line of it at the last moment
short ball on leg stump, Broad gets behind it and fends it out into the leg side
full ball, angled across the right-hander, and he lets it go through to the keeper
full inswinger, angled in at the pads, Buttler defends and it squirts out into the off side
full outswinger, juuust outside the off stump, and Buttler lets it go. There are two types of leave!
beats him! That's a snorter from Starc, 86mph/138kph, bit of nibble back in off the surface, and flies between bat and pad, just missing the off stump on the way through
a touch wider this time, outside the off stump, and Buttler lets it go
full, marginally outside the off stump and Buttler shoulders arms as it flies through to Paine
round the wicket, spins away outside off to beat Broad's lunging push
same again, drifts in at off stump then spins away
brings out the sweep and makes good connection, sends it behind square and wide enough of the deep fielder to keep the strike
left alone outside off
nicely bowled, fired in a touch quicker at middle, defended
presses forward and it squirts off the thickish outside half of the bat wide of second slip
over the wicket, full outside off, punched to mid-off
length ball, straight, takes a thick inside edge down to long leg
aims for the full one, a bit off target as he cannons off the pads wide of short leg
full outside off, he drives but the bat twists in his hand and the ball runs to mid-off
slips down the leg side, Buttler can't catch up with it
gets an inside edge into his back leg as he goes for the drive which means there's no appeal for the lbw
full at middle and leg, Broad sweeps and finds short fine leg
prods forward and defends back to the bowler
starts to shape for the sweep again, then blocks with a straight bat and gets a single off an inside edge to square leg
wide outside off, left alone as it spins and bounces to Paine
fuller, outside off, Buttler pushes forward with his feet stuck in the crease
wide outside off, left alone...keeps Broad facing Starc
full at the stumps, takes the outside edge and runs along the ground to gully who parries it away but they can't take a single
fired down the leg side, Broad jumping across his crease
straight at the stumps, full, Broad hopping back and across manages to defend to mid-on
a shorter delivery, outside off, Broad flaps at it away from his body but avoids the edge
cleaned him up! Broad not in the same postcode as that one...full, swings back in at off stump, smashes into the timber
well played, gets solidly behind the line of a full delivery and defends to mid-on...big cheers from the crowd
forward and defends
shorter outside off, runs it behind point
a flat-batted drive finds the bowler
lovely delivery! Beats everything as this spins past the inside edge and Paine can't take it
nicely played, short outside off, he rocks back and drives through the covers
works a straight ball off his pads and find square leg
length ball at off stump with some shape in, worked to midwicket
a bouncer, sails over Leach's back
he's off the mark in fine style! Gets forward into a full delivery and drives it straight of mid-off...it's chased all the way, but Wade can't quite flick it back
beaten! Good delivery, back of a length outside off, climbs through to the keeper
goes for the yorker, gets it at off stump, well dug out into the covers
huge appeal for lbw, no reviews left for Australia! Full, swinging into the pads, Leach playing across the line. Looked very close. Leach survives. Three reds!
round the wicket, pushed across outside off, left alone
a bottom-handed flick back to Lyon
down the leg side, Buttler can't make contact and rebounds off Paine to short fine leg
full, defended...what can Buttler do?
short outside leg stump, tucked to deep square leg
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
length ball at middle, defended to the on side
gets forward and drives, gets a thick inside edge wide of mid-on and there's time for a second
tries to loft this over the off side, doesn't get the timing but finds enough distance to clear mid-off and keep the strike
follow-on saved! And in some style as he rifles a half volley through the covers, that was a very sweet shot
short outside off, dragged into the leg side out to deep square
back of a length, takes the pad and drops down by Leach's feet
back of a length outside off, left alone
fuller, at the stumps, Buttler gets squared up as he defends
well bowled, good length at off stump, takes the outside but runs along the ground to fourth slip...Buttler camped quite deep in the crease
short ball, goes for the pull but it dribbles into midwicket and he doesn't take the run on offer
goes back and across, tries to flick a length delivery from outside off to the on side but finds mid-on

all over as Buttler aims to big shot down the ground, doesn't make contact and it strikes the off stump...hold on, they are checking the no-ball. It's tight, very but the third umpire rules fractionally okay - bit like the Malinga one during his four wickets in four balls!
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
closer to off stump, full, Warner gets across and pushes towards backward point
good length at off stump, defended into midwicket
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
well bowled! Beaten by a shorter delivery outside off, climbs past the bat as he's late trying to pull away
given lbw! Broad's done it again! A straighter delivery, good length, spears into the pads and Warner is trapped deep in the crease. A pair for Warner, his first in Tests and three ducks in a row
round the wicket, 87mph/140kph, full outside off and driven to mid-off
beaten! That's a terrific delivery as it seams away to comprehensively beat the outside edge
good length outside off, 88mph/141kph, a late withdrawal of the bat allows it through
back of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
a bouncer outside off, 89mph/143kph, very short and comfortably avoided...also a no-ball
well bowled! That's an excellent delivery, on a good length outside off, just straightens enough off the seam to beat Harris. More energy through the crease in this over from Archer
excellent fielding at cover, good support for Archer, this is full outside off and driven sweetly
full outside off, whips the bat across his body as he leaves it alone in what has become a trademark for him
length ball outside off, left alone
extra bounce from back of a length, Labuschagne takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
back of a length at off stump, pushed to the off side and he wants a single but it's not there
touch fuller, at off stump, Labuschagne gets forward as he defends
fuller, pushed back towards the bowler...good over from Broad
gets into a tangle here against a delivery that nips back in from round the wicket
full and the stumps, nicely timed for Australia's first runs off the bat as he drives it wide of mid-on
a shorter delivery, at off stump, 89mph, defended off the splice to midwicket...was in the air for a while
good length at the stumps, 88mph/141kph, defended to the off side
short of a length outside off, seam movement away from Harris but he held his bat well inside the line
short of a length on off stump, played on the back foot and takes an outside edge which gully can't quite cut off
that's gone wrong, wild down the leg side, no chance for Bairstow but it's given byes
gets away with a bottom edge past the stumps and he aims to drive off the back foot into the covers
full at off stump, confidently punched back down the pitch, Broad gets his right hand to it
nicely driven, places this through the covers off the front foot...a man in form
full at off stump, gets well forward, head over the ball, defends to mid-off
angled into the pads, flicked behind square
short of a length at off stump, defended
fuller outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, 88mph/141kph, defended to the off side...just the occasional sign of the ball keeping a touch low at times
fuller, played off the front foot to cover
this one keeps down a little on off stump, defended to mid-on, although Labuschagne was caught on the crease a little
well bowled! Gets this one to beat the outside edge, shorter outside off and climbs past the bat

huge appeal and given lbw! Harris has called the review. Similar to the first innings, round the wicket, takes him on the knee roll. No inside edge, just a question of the stumps...and it's three reds on hitting leg stump
full outside off, left alone
ooh! Smith gets right across his crease and the ball keeps a touch low, manages to get the bat down in time
full outside off, gets forward and drives to mid-off
short of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
what sort of a shot is that? A Steven Smith shot, think he was trying to leave it in the end, full and swinging outside off, takes the toe of the bat through the covers
full outside the off stump, 88mph, driven one-handed through point for a couple
length outside off, 86mph/138kph, left alone
a touch fuller and a touch straighter, in and around fourth stump, Labuschagne defends
outswinger on a length, and beats Labuschagne's defensive prod. Up at 87mph/140kph, moves away and flies past the edge
dragged a touch shorter, and squeezed out down to third man off the shoulder down to third man for four
back of a length on off stump, 90mph/145kph, defended off the back foot while jumping back in his crease
full, fired in at off stump, chipped out towards mid-on on the drive, Smith grimaces as though it has held in the wicket
fired down the leg side, lets it go
full on fifth stump, Smith leaves it alone
ooh, through him! Just full of a length on fourth stump, jags in off the seam and flies between the bat and Smith's back leg. Smith is left open-mouthed!
back of a length and wider outside off, Smith looks to punch through the covers but mistimes it out to the fielder

full, inswinger, on fourth stump and seriously close to nicking the off stump on the way through! Shouldered arms, and stuck out his tongue with a broad smile after it went through to the keeper. Great over from Broad!
just full of a length on fourth or fifth stump, well left by Labuschagne
a touch fuller and tighter to off stump, defended into the off side

big shout and gone! Labuschagne reviews, looked out to the naked eye. Quite full, and very straight, Labuschagne was looking to defend... ooh there might have been a little inside edge here... nope, no bat involved... clipping the bail between middle and leg and Archer has his man! Marnus is spitting and gives some chat in the general direction of England's huddle, only to be waved off on his way
through him first up! Round the wicket, pretty full outside off, and beats Head's drive
full, 90mph/145kph, angled in towards the off stump and dug out well into the off side
sharp bouncer, 88mph/142kph, rushes the batsman who ducks underneath it
fullish outside off, and Smith is beaten looking to defend
fired down the leg side this time, 85mph/137kph, lets it go

short ball, inconsistent bounce, tickled round the corner awkwardly, Head sets off and is sent back! And the throw nearly gets him, would have been very close with a direct hit! And it flies away for overthrows... all happening!
length ball on fourth stump, Smith is back and across, and is hit on the back thigh pad while leaving on length
beaten again outside off, half an inch fuller outside off, on fourth or fifth stump, and Smith can't get bat on it
full on fourth stump, and toe-ended out to mid-on
fullish on fourth stump, and blocked out into the covers
blimey, length ball, a bit wider outside off, and out of nowhere Head gets out the booming cover drive which races away for four
length ball, angling it towards leg stump at 90mph/145kph, and Head flicks it off the hip out to long leg for a couple
length ball, on the stumps, and blocked out into the cover region
edged through the slips! Awkward length on off stump, Head didn't know whether to go forward or back, and edged it just wide of the diving left hand of Stokes in the cordon
very tight to the stumps, full on fourth stump and Smith digs it out. 93mph/150kph!
full angling in from outside off, and plays a checked drive out to the man at cover
very wide on the crease, length ball that Head has a cross-batted slash at, which dribbles out towards mid-off off the back foot
struck on the pad, big appeal but sliding down the leg side. Length ball, hit above the knee roll and going way down. Hawk-Eye confirms it would barely have hit a second set!
length outside off, angled in towards fourth stump, and pushed out into the covers
strays a fraction straight, and whipped around the corner towards fine leg by Head
that's a loose ball from Broad, short and wide outside off, Smith's eyes light up and he dispatches it through the covers with aplomb
length on fourth stump on thereabouts, Head is caught in two minds whether or not to fish at it and ends up withdrawing his dangling bat at the last moment
full on fourth stump, looks to force it through extra cover with lots of bottom hand and doesn't get much of it
big inswing on a length, 89mph/143kph, and strikes Head high on the front leg, around the thigh pad
sharp short ball, 90.5mph/146kph, Head tries to fend it away and is hit on the left bicep. A few words exchanged
delightful drive through cover for four! A touch wide, length ball outside off, and driven brilliantly

tiiiiimber! Archer wins the battle! Ooh, another look at the front foot... he's pushing the line, but there's a fraction of the boot behind the line. Little bit of movement in from around the wicket, full and straight, Head is trying to defend but this rips through him and pings middle stump out of the ground!
short outside off, hint of movement away, Smith is in his bubble and ducks calmly underneath it
full on off stump, Smith looks to tuck it into the leg side but finds Roy at short midwicket
full and straight, Smith defends solidly back down the pitch
bumper, 86mph/138kph, but fired down the leg side
full, hung outside off on fifth stump, left alone
full on fourth stump, Smith gets forward and blocks it out to short midwicket
fired in at the pads, worked out to midwicket firmly
short outside off, 89mph/144kph, drops the hands and sways inside it
yorker length on off stump, dug out into the off side
short ball, 92mph/148kph, ducks underneath it and gets another verbal volley from Archer. Boiling up!
straight ball on a length, angled in at middle-and-leg, and worked away off his pads for one round the corner
fired in down the leg side, Smith lets it go, completely unfazed by the situation
back of a length, angling in from around the wicket, punched out into the covers
similar ball, length on fourth stump, Wade looks to dab it late through gully, Kane Williamson-style, but finds the fielder
squared up, full outside off, seams away from the leftie, beats him, and flies through to Bairstow
full, fired down the leg side, and clipped out to long leg. Leach misfields and they get back for a couple
wide on the crease, length ball angling in and clipped out to midwicket. Broad's pace is a little down this over, just 81mph/130kph, that one
yorker-length, angling in towards the off stump, and dug out into the off side
tight to the stumps, full of a length and worked out for a single to wide mid-on
back of a length and wild outside the off stump, Wade lets it go through to Bairstow
full, 91mph/146kph, dug out into the covers and they get back for a scampered second after some decent work from Buttler at wide mid-off
angling in from outside off, Wade shoulders arms
length ball, on off stump, and Wade defends back to the bowler
bumper, 91mph/146kph, Wade ducks beneath it
length on off stump, shuffles across and defends out to mid-on
full and straight, whipped off his pads down to fine leg
full outside off, driven out to the right of wide mid-off, and they scuttle through for one
short ball, 82mph/132kph, doesn't get up much but Smith ducks exaggeratedly underneath it
length ball on leg stump, worked out to backwards square and they run very well to come back for a second
full on leg stump, worked out to mid-on for no run
full on off stump, Wade brings out the sweep and times it well. They come back for a couple
fuller still, on off stump, sweeps again and it dribbles out to the man on the fence as they jog through for one
decent turn away from the bat, Smith gets back and pushes it out to cover
full and straight, Smith uses the feet and flamingoes it out to straight midwicket. Archer catches up with it, dives over the rope, and just gets back over it in time to save the boundary
errs straight, and nudged out into the leg side for one
a touch short, Smith gets back and knocks it out to straight midwicket for one. That one looked like it stuck in the pitch a bit
just full of a length on fourth stump, Smith defends back down the track
length ball on fourth stump, Smith defends
strays a touch straight, Smith helps it round the corner for an easy single down to long leg
length ball hung outside the off stump, Wade shoulders arms
nip-backer which moves in sharply off the pitch, Wade leaves it alone but it's not a million miles away from nipping his off stump
length ball on fifth stump, Wade defends off the back foot
round the wicket, full at the stumps, an inside-out drive which is well fielded by Roy at cover
powerful shot! Dances down the pitch and drills this straight down the on side of the pitch, a skimming one-bounce shot
shorter on off stump, a response to being pumped down the ground, he angles the face and sends it towards third man
pops into the on side, not sure if there was bat, trickles to short fine leg for a scampered single...just pad, and no short leg anyway
pushed into the off side
gets away with this, a rare piece of misjudgement, and nice piece of bowling, as he comes down the pitch and gets it very high, with just enough legs to clear mid-off running back
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to cover
good length at off stump, 83mph, defended
angles a length ball into the gully area
beaten by a good one outside off, back of a length and nibbles off the scrambled seam
fuller, at off stump, driven to mid-off
short of a length outside off, defended towards point
full at middle and leg, angled into space on the off side
gets right across outside off and defends
touch fuller, worked from outside off into the leg side
whips this down the ground with strong bottom hand
good spin from out of the footmarks, Wade a bit uncertain as he defends and gets an inside edge into his pad
good batting, tucks another one from outside off to midwicket
full at off stump, defended
back of a length, at off stump, defended
goes after a short-of-a-length delivery, pulled high over midwicket and it plugs in the outfield
gets across the crease and whips a full, straight delivery to deep midwicket
steers a ball outside off towards gully
angled to backward point with an open face
full on the stumps, Smith leans forward and pushes to cover
sweeps strongly from outside leg stump, it's a freebie boundary because there's no one at deep square leg - which looks like a mistake!
opens up his stance and drives to the deepish mid-oiff
some turn and bounce from the rough, but no one catching in front of bat
a straighter delivery which spins down the leg side
plays forward and it takes an inside edge to short fine leg
back of a length, straight, he gets inside the line and tucks off the hip to long leg
top shot! One of the best of the innings. Short of a length outside off, stands tall and drives it square off the back foot
defends a short-of-a-length delivery to point
good delivery, holds off the seam and takes a leading edge as Wade looks to turn into the leg side
touch fuller, at off stump, defends
a bouncer, comfortably through to the keeper
over the wicket, goes back and defends
this spins quite sharply from out of the rough, but Smith adjusts and defends
brings out the reverse sweep, doesn't make contact
dabs this from around leg stump backward of point on the off side, good use of the wrists
and now Wade tries to reverse, takes him on the forearm
attempts a conventional sweep this time and, again, can't connect
nearly dragged on! A full delivery at off stump, Smith tries to whip it away, takes a thick inside edge which goes into his boot and trickles towards the stumps
good length at off stump, defended
brilliant stroke, a bottom-handed whip off the stumps which goes wide of mid-on
another inside edge past the stumps as he defends at a full delivery
round the wicket, full outside off, a skewed drive to mid-on
short of a length, defended to cover
full outside leg, gets over the top and sweeps it fine of short fine leg
plays forward and taps into midwicket
sweeps from outside off and goes straight to leg slip
another sweep, taken on the back leg this time
swept from wide outside off and almost picks out the man at square leg
Stokes almost pulls of a brilliant catch from slip as he saw Smith going for the reverse sweep and started to move, then got his hand to the ball but couldn't hold on
full outside off, tapped square into point and it takes Smith to fifty as this freakish series continues
round the wicket, full outside off, defended to point
whips this strongly off the stumps but straight to Archer at mid-on
full outside off, slides off the face towards gully
very full outside off, Wade drives over the top of it
across to off stump and defends to backward point
sweeps and misses, rebounds off the pad to the off side
brings out the reverse, or actually the switch hit this time, but finds leg slip...doing as he pleases, again
worked through the leg side
opens the face and steers this from off stump through backward point

goes for the sweep, the ball loops to slip...given not out by Dharmasena and Root calls the review. Wade was ready to review if he was given out! And this has come straight off the forearm. Stokes wasn't convinced either
down the pitch, takes it on the full from wide outside off to deep midwicket
stays round the wicket, good length on off stump, defended
swung through the leg side, angled into his hip, a free swing of the arms from Wade
that's a dreamy cover drive, full outside off, slotted perfectly in the gap between cover and mid-off. Almost as textbook as it gets from Smith
full at the stumps, defended to midwicket
full and straight, defended to mid-off
opens the face to a length ball on off stump, steers into point
pulled away dismissively! You run out of words for Smith, it's a back-of-a-length delivery and he pulls it over straight midwicket
now he gives himself some room outside and angles this down to third man, 88mph and he played it like it was a medium-pacer
moves to leg again, it's a short ball and tries to upper cut but it's a rare time he misses
short again, 88mph, Smith lets it go through to the keeper after thinking of flaying it somewhere
I've not really any idea how to describe this, but it's some sort of forehand swat to a short ball which dribbles back towards the bowler
flicked off the body to square...peak Steve Smith in that over
played to mid-on
worked off the pads to deep square
full outside off, a stand-and-deliver drive finds one of the cover ring
a might heave over the leg side, not his most well-timed shot but successfully dragged from outside off over wide mid-on
flayed through the off side this time, driving down on his back knee
short at the body, pulled to deep square leg and splits the fielders nicely for the second run
a slower short ball, Smith swats gently into the leg side as he adjusts for the change of pace
short outside off, Smith is well outside off and almost falling over as it goes over his shoulder to the keeper
short again, follows him as he moves to leg then leaves it alone
another short ball, 87mph, goes over Smith's head as he ducks and sways
short and carved to deep point
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed to point
follows Smith way outside leg stump and it's pushed to mid-on
gets plenty of bat on this one as he pulls a short delivery wide of mid-on while almost ending up of the pitch as he does so
oh dear, Broad was expecting Smith to move to leg again. He didn't. Flings it miles down the leg side. Broad, brilliantly, then asks why it was wides
short, straight, tucked to long leg
round the wicket, back of a length, worked to midwicket
full, driven past Broad and then scamper a single to mid-off
hammered! Another crunching pull/swat/whatever else you want to call it as Broad goes short and Smith just dismisses it straight of mid-on
slower ball to start outside the off stump, Wade defends
full outside off, up at 88mph/142kph, driven out for one into the covers
Smith steps outside leg, Archer follows him with a ferocious 88mph/142kph bouncer, and Smith hits the deck, losing his balance ducking underneath it
steps to the off side this time, miles across, and Archer sends a length ball just past the leg stump
full on leg stump, 89mph/143kph, and worked out to square leg in an unusually orthodox fashion
short ball, which Wade ducks underneath

length outside off, Smith shimmies down the track and belts this miles up in the air, Stokes moves round to his left from long-off, set himself... and snaffles it! Smith falls for his lowest score of the series, would you believe, after a quite remarkable innings
works this down to long-on for a single
full from Leach, and decent turn away as Paine rocks back and defends
big turn this time on a length, chopped out to the cover sweeper for a jogged single
length ball, spinning in towards the leftie, who punches it out through the covers for a couple
full and wide, driven forcefully away to the cover boundary
half-volley, driven out into the off side and they scamper through for a single

gone! Great catch by Bairstow! Length outside off, Wade looks to slash it away through the covers, gets a thick edge and Bairstow - at full stretch - sticks out a hopeful left hand and it nestles in his glove. Archer wins the battle with Wade
wide outside off, lets it go
full, angled in towards off stump, edged away between slip and gully for one
straight, length ball. Paine is struck on the pad trying to work into the leg spin
plays and misses at one outside the off stump looking to drive through the covers. A wry smile from Archer
ooh ripper! Turns out of the rough, beats Starc, and beats Bairstow too, nearly shaves a bail on the way through and flies through for a bye
tossed up, full and straight, Paine belts it down the ground to long-on for four!
throws this one wider, and Paine spanks this through extra cover for another boundary! Disdainful...
bizarre shot, tries to paddle it and dink it to third man at the same time and ends up inside edging into the pads
tossed up, yorker length, and bunted back to the bowler
pulls out the reverse, nails it, and it flies away for the third boundary of the over!
angled into the pads from round the wicket, and tucked out to the midwicket sweeper for one
tight to the stumps, full on fifth stump, mistimes the drive and finds mid-off
length ball just outside off, punched out to short cover
length ball on fourth stump, Paine tries to force it through midwicket on the swivel but bottom edges it, and it dribbles out to mid-on
short ball outside off, 87mph/140kph, Paine pulls in front of square for four!
short ball outside off, Paine ducks underneath it and draws a quizzical look from Archer
length ball outside off, angling into the left-hander, and punched out to the cover sweeper
length ball outside off, thwacked out to the cover sweeper for a couple. Roy dived at short cover and got something on it on the way through and looks to be in a bit of pain
short ball outside off, Paine clubs it just out of Roy's reach at short cover, and it plugs for a couple
very wide outside off, too wide for Paine to get anything on it and called as such

big appeal! Not given. Paine tried to pull the short ball on the swivel, and didn't make any contact, but as much as a delaying tactic as anything, Root decides to review after a lengthy think about it... Nope, nothing on it, and England burn a pointless review. Looks like it's even been called a wide! Blimey, that has backfired for them...
very short again, pulled out to long leg for a single
full and straight, looks to whack it over the leg side and inside edges onto the pad for a single
back of a length from round the wicket, Burns blocks it down into the off side
wide on the crease, a touch fuller and straighter, Burns defends back down the pitch

leading edge, and gone! Full of a length and straight, Burns looks to work it into the leg side, gets a leading edge, and it floats up to wide mid-off/short cover! Head takes a pretty straightforward, knee-high, and that is exactly the start that Australia would have wanted

BOWLED 'IM! Absolute ripper from Cummins, England are in disarray! This is more or less the perfect delivery for a right-arm seamer to a right-hander. On a length, nips away off the seam, kisses the top of the off stump past Root's defences, and Cummins wheels away in celebration. What a start for Australia!
full, 87mph/140kph, angling in towards the off stump and Roy lunges forward to defend down the pitch
straighter this time, in line with middle stump, and Roy defends out to mid-on
firmly defended into the off side
slightly full of a length, angling in towards off stump, and defended
length outside the off stump, Denly shoulders arms to it
great ball, a touch shorter, hits Denly on the glove or even the back forearm as it gets big on him
here we go again, Denly is beaten outside his off stump! Just holds its line outside the off stump, and beats his defensive prod
length ball on fourth or fifth stump, and defends it into the covers
beaten outside off, hangs this one on sixth stump or thereabouts, Roy has a little prod at it and can't connect
strays a bit too straight, Roy clips it off the pad out to square leg to get himself and his team off the mark
just full of a length angled in towards off stump, 87mph/140kph, Roy defends with hard hands back down the pitch
length ball angled in at off stump, Roy pushes his hands at the defensive shot and plays it back to Cummins down the pitch
a touch wider, slightly full of a length. Roy looks for a trademark checked drive through the off side, but only finds wide mid-off
fired in full and straight, clipped out to midwicket for England's first boundary. Nicely played
fullish outside off, defends into the off side
back of a length and a touch straight, Denly works it out into the on side off the thigh
fullish in at leg stump, flicks off the pad out towards short leg
hung outside off stump on a length, Denly lets it go
length ball angling in towards fourth stump, pushes defensively out into the covers
sharp bumper to finish, 86mph/138kph, and Denly ducks underneath it
length ball outside off, Roy plays a back-foot punch out to cover
slightly full of a length, in towards middle stump, prods out to Wade at short leg who fields on the bounce
hangs one outside off, Roy shoulders arms and it flies through to Paine
shoulders arms again, fairly wide outside off again
fuller and straighter, Roy works it out to midwicket and they scamper through for a couple
straight, length ball, defended out into the leg side
shuffles across to the off side and works it out towards mid-on
full outside off, and Denly slog-sweeps firmly for four! Bosh!
slightly full of a length outside off, hint of turn, and Denly defends it out to mid-on
full outside off, tries to slog-sweep again and Denly is beaten! Not far away from the off stump at all!
full on off stump, and knocked out to mid-on on the half-volley
skips down the pitch to meet this on the half-volley, and knocks it out to midwicket to keep the strike
angling across him, just outside the off stump, and prodded into the off side
full, but quite wide outside Denly's off stump to the extent he can happily let it fly through to Paine
hangs another full one outside off, and again Denly lets it go through to the keeper
fires in a leg-stump yorker, squeezed out very well by Denly from under his feet
full again, 90mph/145kph, and driven out towards extra cover on the half-volley. They come back for three, and Denly will survive until tomorrow
length ball, slung down the leg side, and it flies through harmlessly to Paine
full and straight, hint of shape in at Denly who drives it to mid-on
full outside off, left alone, again it shapes back

big appeal for lbw! Dharmasena shakes his head. Angling down the leg side, and maybe an inside edge. Hazlewood has this ball moving, this one nipped off the seam from a full length and beat Denly's drive. No bat
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, 86mph/138kph, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, Denly raises his bat out of the line. Good opening over from Hazlewood
full outside off, Roy gets forward with a hard-handed defensive shot
beaten by a good one in the channel outside off on a good length, draws Roy forward and away from his body
