flicked in the air! But wide of short midwicket, whipped off the pads for the first boundary of the day but it got Australia excited
back of a length at off stump, defended
full outside off, Roy moves across the crease then leaves it alone
back of a length, straight, defended with a straight bat to mid-on
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
that's a beauty! A length delivery that angles in at off stump then nips away off the seam to beat the edge
fuller, at the stumps, comes forward and defends
good length outside off, left alone and zips through nicely to Paine
pushes a length ball into the off side, wide of cover
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
punched in the air, but short of mid-off! Denly early into his shot against a full delivery, did it stop in the pitch? We saw a little of that yesterday
huge appeal for lbw, Cummins is sure but Erasmus says not out and Paine indicates going down leg...good length, nipped back into the knee roll. Close, but Paine is right. Missing leg
full and straight, punched firmly to mid-on
full at middle and off, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, 84mph/135kph, defended to cover
length ball, straight, defended to cover. Probing start from Cummins
back of a length at off stump, defended
back of a length, angled into the pads, rebounds back down the pitch towards short mid-on
back of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length, he plays back and across, defends with a high left elbow
slips into the pads, tucked to long leg
a bouncer, angled over leg stump, he ducks
full outside off, gets forward and defends with quite low hands
beaten on the inside edge, a back-of-a-length delivery which Roy plays as though it kept a bit low but think he misjudged the length
a bouncer down the leg side
full at off stump, pushes forward with much footwork, squeezes it wide of midwicket
goes underneath another short ball, 88mph/141kph
back of a length at off stump, solidly behind the line and defends down by his feet
full at off stump, just a hint of shape in, Roy presses forward and pushes firmly to cover
good length at off stump, Roy defends awkwardly and perhaps this one did keep a touch low
pushed down the leg side, through to the keeper
short of a length, nips back and Roy who just about manages to keep it out in pretty ungainly fashion off the toe end of the bat
angled into the hip, worked down to long leg
full and straight, 83mph/133kph, defended to mid-on
over the wicket, on the pads and clipped to deep square leg
misses his flick, taken on the pad but it's pitched outside leg stump
full at off stump, better line, defended to the off side
back of a length, angled across and he makes a late decision to leave alone

flashes over the slips! Jeepers, that would have been a horror if it went to slip...a very full and wide delivery, Denly leans out for a drive he can barely reach and it's a thick edge over third slip (Labuschagne) who barely reacts and stays crouched
aims for the yorker, it's a low full toss which is pushed through the covers...as so often, plenty happening when Starc has the ball
full outside off, kicked away to slip
there's spin from the rough, quite a wide line outside off, Denly presses forward
brings out the sweep, as he did last night, takes it from wide outside off and splits the men at deep square and deep midwicket
gets across to off stump and flicks to the on side
plays the slog-sweep again, this time straight to deep midwicket
gets forward to a full delivery outside off, defended to cover
goes for the yorker again, it's pretty much on target, dug out by Denly
full outside off, goes across and is left alone
short of a length outside off, Denly eyes up a square cut but gets a bottom edge into the pitch
on the pads, flicked down to long leg
very full, another low full toss I think, nicely timed off the toes as he flicks it wide of mid-on
full at off stump, gets forward and defends, ball runs to the on side
uses his feet then clips a ball from outside off into midwicket
extra bounce on this, Roy manages to keep it down around the corner...no leg slip in place
thick inside edge which flies high and wide of short. That's the spot from Lyon, a good length outside off with some spin. Roy lunging forward
goes straight on outside off, defended
just short of deep midwicket as he goes for another slog-sweep, doesn't keep it down...jeepers, he's living a charmed life
very full outside off, driven to backward point
vicious delivery! A well-directed short ball which has Denly in a tangle, eyes off the ball and thrusts his gloves out...the ball balloons to the off side but short of point
that's a nice response, full delivery outside off, gets forward and drives to short cover
back of a length at middle and off, defended with a slightly open face to backward point
chases another wide delivery, driving well away from his body, picks out short cover...Australia feeding it
short of a length outside off, square drives off the back foot, not perfectly timed and it's hauled in on the cover boundary
good length at middle and off, takes a thick inside edge towards midwicket for a well-judged single
tossed up very full, inviting the drive, Roy finds cover
a big wide full toss which Roy can't take advantage of as he drives to point
a shorter delivery outside off, spins quite sharply and Roy defends on the back foot
gets forward and pushes a full delivery nicely through the covers to bring up England's fifty - and the fifty stand - to warm applause
very full again outside off, left alone and Paine can't take it cleanly
more on off stump, again it spins, defended to the on side
round the wicket, change of angle, short of a length and worked into midwicket
gets across to off stump and plays a length ball to midwicket
full outside off and that's a perfect cover drive as he gets forward and drills it through the off side
that's a good one! Back of a length angling in at off stump and it jags away to beat the outside edge. Nod of appreciation from Roy
fraction fuller, into off stump, defended off the splice as he plays forward
full at off stump, defended to cover...a hint of reverse swing
too full, down leg, clipped to long-on
tossed up outside off, very full. Lets it go, but it has Paine in some trouble as it rears up. He does well to gather in front of his helmet
good length, defended on the front foot

loud appeal but it struck him outside the line and wasn't coming back enough to hit the stumps either. Tuns out it might have clipped the stumps on umpire's call. Roy was caught on the crease a bit and played for turn that wasn't there, but he was moving across and it struck him on the pad
uses his feet to come down and clip it off his toes through midwicket
big turn, right across the batsman, who stays back and tucks it to short fine leg
length outside off, and he lets it go
full outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot
full outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
angling in on a length from around the wicket, and Roy has his off stump covered as he lets it go through

through him. Starc gets his yorker on target - well not exactly on target because it was just outside off. Roy doesn't get bat on it while trying to defend and it sneaks through the gap, but just outside off
fuller outside off, driven off the front foot but not timed well perfectly. Beats the bowler on his follow through but Cummins at mid-off dives to his right to parry the ball away and slow it down
skips down the track and defends it into the onside
down the track again, the spin beats him and he's hit on the pads. Too far down for it to be given, and it was turning too
defended on the front foot
hangs back to this length ball and whips it nicely through midwicket

big appeal once again, but they decide not to review. Length ball outside off, he's lunging forward to defend, and is struck on the pads. Looked like he was playing a shot there, and since it's well outside the line, that can't be given
overthrows and Lyon isn't happy. This was flicked to midwicket for a quick single. A shy at the stumps results in further runs
lovely looking cover drive, but straight to the man at cover
nipping in from outside off, but it was slightly back of a length so he's safe in leaving this as it bounces over the stumps
nipping in on a length again, and raps his pads
inside edge trickles to backward square leg. Wide enough of off and full enough to attempt the drive, but it tailed in a bit and took the edge
back of a length outside off, he pulls out of playing a shot

bowled through the gate. There's the opening Australia were seeking since the morning, and it's Pat Cummins - again - who has delivered it. Roy has been pushing forward through his innings, and been vulnerable to the incoming delivery. Cummins gets the length and movement perfect and rearranges the stumps, with a big gap left between bat and pad.
length outside off, kept a tad low but he watched it carefully and defended

through him. Was there bat on that? Drifts gently away and breaks in sharply to hit pad and bounce up. in fact there was an inside edge on it too. Pushing forward to defend but the turn means he inside-edged onto pad and it bounced up to Paine. Can't call that a drop, went up to his face nearly
stays back and clips it to square leg
goes well back and keeps it out, even though it kept low
length on off, Stokes plays it off the back foot again, patting it back to the bowler
given more air that time and Stokes gets a big stride out to defend on middle and leg
jags in off a length again, and beats Denly's forward defensive to hit him in the midriff
length outside off, defended carefully to cover
full on the stumps, opens the face to defend towards point from the crease
bouncer, but ducked under easily as it's going down leg

flies off the outside edge. He was caught in two minds on whether to play it or leave it, ends up too late in getting the bat out of the way of a length ball angling into him and it flies past third slip
more in control that time, waits for the ball and steers it by opening the bat face well wide of third slip
low full toss, nudged into the leg side
fullish length on the stumps and turning away but he takes a big stride out to smother the spin and defend
that one spit up from a length, and broke sharply past the outside edge. Stokes played it wel in the end, going back and getting the bat out of the way to let it go on
fuller, defended on the front foot again
clipped towards midwicket
good length and Stokes gets that lunge going again to get to the pitch and defend it solidly
back of a length outside off, he's not interested in having his bat anywhere near that
past the outside edge, gets it to straighten off a length and there is an uncertain poke at it
length ball outside off, punched to cover but not timed well
good length coming into him, gets behind it and defends with a straight bat
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot but it rolls towards mid-on from the inside half of his bat
nicely driven to the bowler's left, but mid-off gathers it comfortably
full, drifting towards leg, defended
good length, spins from middle but Stokes gets his bat down in time to jab it away
fuller, inviting him on the front foot and Stokes comes forward and drives with the full face, to extra cover
drags this shorter and Stokes goes back to slap it, but it bounces off the silly mid-off's foot
length on the stumps, defended on the front foot
strays down leg and stokes clips it to deep square leg. Off the mark
good length, nipping across him, and he keeps bat close to his body, allowing ball to go past

Stokes is walking - what a massive moment! This was a corker of a delivery, bowled on the stumps, back of a length, insistently pushing Stokes on the back foot and so close to his body that he had to play at it. He realised too late that wearing the blow on his body might be better and was taking the bat out of the way. It must have got a tickle through - as soon as Paine moves to his right to gather it, he was celebrating, Cummins was appealing. And then Stokes was walking, even though the umpire hadn't indicated anything.
length outside off, defended
oooh, it's all happening here suddenly. Length ball, jagging in sharply again, flies off the thigh pad and Paine can't gather. It goes to the boundary for four leg byes
good length on the stumps, turned into the legside
fuller on leg stump, pushed towards mid-on
too full, flicked off his pads to deep square leg
length ball outside off, keeps his bat well out of the way by tucking it behind is back almost to let it go
length outside off, defended to point

big appeal and not given, but Paine is not reviewing. They were asking for a caught behind but the ball hit his front pad on the way through to Paine. Another one that is coming in and has the batsman in trouble, he pushes outside the line and it takes the pad to the keeper. Wouldn't have been lbw also, with impact showing umpire's call
superb response. Too full outside off and he drives it crisply through cover for a lovely cover drive for four
bouncer, stays low and sways his head out of the way
length ball outside off, stays beside it and pushes to point
bouncer, but a bit too short and he spotted it early and ducks under it
that one died on the keeper. Length ball nipping in, left alone. Awkward take for Paine
length on off, solid forward defense towards mid-on. Cummins has over-stepped though, so he'll have to re-bowl that
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
fuller and straighter, turned off his pads to backward square leg
some shape away from the batsman but too far outside off to interest Bairstow in laying bat on it
kept low but Denly keeps it out by getting his bat down in time. Length ball angling into him
good length on off, gets behind it to defend

jagging in off a length again and catches Denly in a bit of a tangle again. The variable bounce is showing, because that one took off and hit him in the midriff, sneaking past the inside edge as he was coming forward to defend
length ball angling in, squeezed towards mid-on
good length outside off, nipping in but Denly judges it well enough and knows he can shoulder arms to this because it's not coming back enough to threaten pad or stumps
oooh, past the outside edge. Loss of concentration perhaps, last ball before lunch? He had a poke at this one, bowled in the channel on a length, but it whizzes past the outside edge
good start, back of a length and angling in, bounces a touch more and takes Bairstow in the stomach
full, worked to the on side
back of a length at middle and off, defended a little awkwardly
very full outside off, driven off the cue end to the covers
full outside off, left alone and climbs nicely to Paine
full again, outside off, 84mph/135kph and left alone
starts straight and spins down the leg side
comes down the pitch, doesn't quite get to the ball but manages to clip it to short fine leg before he over balances
very full, flicked to midwicket
touch shorter, he plays back and works it behind square
short again, worked off the back foot to the leg side
a little too short and a little too straight, played to the on side
full outside off, nicely forward and drives to mid-off
that's a super shot! Drives it handsomely straight of mid-off to take him to a very good half-century. Battled hard
back of a length, defended to point
ducks into a short ball! Didn't quite get up as he expected and he takes it flush on the shoulder. Took his eyes off it again
nearly dragged on as he defends a length delivery, comes off the inside part of the bat down by his feet
more uncertainty as he makes a late decision to leave a full delivery outside off and it runs off the face, but along the ground to the slips
outside off, back of a length, steered to point
fuller, outside off, left alone. Paine stops it with his pad
works a straight delivery down in front of short leg
full outside off, leans forward and defends
doesn't quite carry to short leg! Extra bounce, fended off the splice but inches in front
straighter, worked off the pads to short fine leg
full and straight, defended
short of a length, angling in at off stump, defended to the off side
touch fuller, at off stump, 84mph, defended
a bouncer, 83mph, angled down the leg side
another bouncer, outside off this time, through to the keeper
back of a length, defended and it squirts towards short leg
plays back and tucks a straight delivery into square leg
there it is for Lyon! The extra bounce does the trick, this is back of a length outside off, jumps at Denly who can only fend it off the glove to short leg
sharp spin outside off! Buttler leaves it alone, it bounces and isn't too far from the gloves as well
more big spin! Buttler lets it hit him high above the pads
fuller, whipped from outside off to mid-on
gets forward, takes off a thick inside edge and dribbles around the corner
back of a length at middle and off, defended
full, Buttler slicing across it a little and gets a thick outside edge which flies wide of the slips to third man
back of a length outside off, left alone
worked off the pads into square leg
that's a sharp bouncer, 85mph/136kph, but it's very short and clears both batsman and wicketkeeper...actually leapt off the pitch
lovely follow-up, back on a good length outside off, slides past the outside edge
works a straight ball backward of square...Lyon won't mind bowling at Buttler
good line outside off, rips into Buttler who lifts the bat up at the last moment but that's close to inside edge and gloves
full and driven to mid-off...chance to go through the gate here
pushed down the leg side
spins sharply from a good length outside off, takes Buttler on the thigh pad
starts on middle and leg, spins well down the leg side, left alone
short of a length outside off, played from the back foot with an open face and it slides through backward point
short on the hip, tucked to long leg
full outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, doesn't bounce much, Buttler manages to work to the leg side
full at off stump, defended
length at off stump, defended
full at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full outside off, nicely driven through the covers but Lyon shouldn't mind that
works a straight ball off the pads through square leg
just short of a length outside off, he plays back and tucks it to the leg side
down the leg side, beats Paine and runs towards fine leg...didn't touch anything
back and across, nurdled off the pads backward of square
short of a length, straight, tucked to the leg side
good length at off stump, defended
angled in at middle and off, defended on the back foot
this comes back sharply off the seam, but started wide enough, and was just short enough, for Buttler to leave
worked off the pads to mid-on
full outside off, left alone, tails back as it travels to Paine
spins from the rough outside off, takes the pads to the off side
goes back and across, defends a slightly shorter delivery
fuller, outside off, that's the spot, Bairstow reaches forward and guides it backward of point
gets forward and defends
shorter, he goes back and works it to short fine leg
fuller, outside off, Buttler again going well back and works to the leg side
back of a length, defended
fuller at off stump, defended to the covers
good length, angling in at off stump, 85mph/136kph, defended back to the bowler
some late shape in on a full length, defended to the on side
at the stumps, tucked wide of mid-on...Cummins opts to stop it with his boot
back of a length outside off, 82mph/132kph, left alone
full at off stump and still played off the back foot, turned to short leg
full, wider outside off, driven nicely straight of mid-off
plays back and works to short leg
round the wicket, full at the toes, whipped to deep square leg
that's a lovely shot! Full at off stump, Buttler flicks it delightfully wide of mid-on
back over the wicket, very full at off stump, flicked to mid-on
round the wicket, starts with a bouncer at 84mph/135kph which dies on its way to Paine
full outside off, left alone
short of a length, angled down the leg side, excellent take from Paine and it wasn't too far from Bairstow's gloves
back of a length at off stump, 88mph/141kph, defended to mid-on
short of a length, punched off the back foot towards mid-on
full at the stumps, a strong flick of the wrists sends this through midwicket
short of a length outside off, driven off the back foot to deep cover
nicely bowled, full outside off, good spin away, left alone
touch short, driven off the back foot through the covers
stays back and punches to deep cover, needs to bring the batsman forward
that's better, full at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up full at middle, pushed to the on side
stays round the wicket, short of a length, tucked just to the right of mid-on
short of a length, wide outside off, left alone
short of a length again, makes him play this time, defended to cover
defended to cover
keeps it short of a length, defended towards point
fraction fuller, 88mph/141kph, at off stump, defended to cover...not much movement for Starc
short, wide outside off, spins quite sharply and played off the back foot
straighter, worked off the pads to short fine leg
a little slower this time, on off stump, worked to the leg side
outside off stump, worked past short leg
fuller, outside off, he comes forward this time and defends
short outside off, spins quite sharply as it's left alone. Tidy maiden to start with
tossed up very full, driven back to the bowler
full at middle, defended
spins away sharply outside off, left alone
full at middle and leg, clipped towards mid-on
shorter, he plays back and works it behind square
a full toss outside leg, clipped through midwicket and there's a fumble in the deep

strikes first ball back! Bairstow given lbw but he's gone for a review. Caught on the crease to a length ball, bowled from around the wicket and nipping back into him. He didn't account for the movement and the ball goes past his inside edge to strike the knee roll. DRS shows two reds and umpire's call on hitting the stumps. Bairstow's resistance is done, and Starc has broken through
oooh similar ball to the one that got Bairstow, angling in from around the wicket but didn't move as much and Overton does well to jab it away

edged through the slips. Bowled wider of off stump and Overton can't resist the urge to feel bat on ball and pushes at it, but with soft hands. It bounces well before the slips and goes between second and third
length ball in the channel, he shoulders arms
back of a length, keeps it outside off, Buttler lets it through
same length but gets it on off stump, defended back
length ball, tapped into the leg side
good length, brings him forward to defend, which he does solidly
shorter, goes right back and whips it, but can't go past short leg
length ball again, goes very deep and pats it into the leg side
good length outside off, lunges out to defend it
good length, goes right back and clips towards midwicket
good length in the channel, lets it go
back of a length on the fifth stump line, Buttler's resolutely not touching those
yorker on the fifth stumps, opens the bat face to steer it to point
gets the yorker straighter on the stumps, but Buttler stays deep in his crease and drives it with an open bat face through point
that kept low. Length and homing in on off stump, but Buttler does well to get his bat down and defend it back
length ball outside off, he's back to shouldering arms
full on the stumps, worked off the front foot to fine leg, but not very convincingly
fuller on the stumps, driven off the front foot, but mid-off moves to his left quickly to tumble and save
good length in the corridor, lets it through
attempted yorker on the stumps, defended from the crease
full on the stumps, driven crisply but straight to mid-off
length ball in the channel, he's not touching that
length ball outside off, goes right back and turns it to square leg off his pads
length ball, stays deep in his crease and tucks it to short fine leg's left
moves across to another sharply spinning one and it goes off the flap of the pad to short leg
worked off the front foot this time to square leg
length ball, it's a length that is allowing them to go deep and play him off the backfoot, which Buttler does again, using his wrists to turn to square leg
better length that time, and draws him forward to defend. Hits his pad and they go up in appeal. Not out and no review, probably striking him outside the line
oooh that moved a huge way. Hits the seam on a length and it jags away significantly, ends up at first slip almost

caught in two minds there Buttler, wanted to leave it but was late in getting bat out of the way. Kept his hands soft and loose though, so even though the ball hit bat, it bounced well before reaching the slips
beaten. Super length, on the fourth stump and straightens, to whistle past Buttler's outside edge as he pokes at it
this one comes in with the angle, but is back of a length so Buttler lets it go, as it bounces over the stumps
beaten again, jagging away from a length. This changed ball is playing tricks. Comes in a tad and moves away, Buttler is left connecting with air as he tries to defend on the front foot
and beats the outside edge again! Buttler plays inside the line of this one, keeping bat close to body, as it whizzes past the outside edge from a length
very full outside off, defended back down the pitch on the front foot
full outside off, defended towards gully on the front foot
shorter, but it spits up from a length and surprises him. He's stayed well back though and manages to pat it down towards leg slip
fullish on off, comes on the front foot to turn it to the legside
through batsman and keeper for four byes. Nice loop on that and Overton goes to drive it, but it drifts past the bat and spins in, beats Paine too
patted back to the bowler
if it's Cummins then the ball must be moving away again. Fuller this time and Buttler is defending on the front foot, squirts off the outside edge wide of the slips
bounces just short of third slip. Took off from a length and caught the splice of the bat to a surprised Buttler, but didn't carry
tight line, in the channel and moving in this time, but Buttler has the stumps covered and shoulders arms
length on middle stump, tapped into the legside on the back foot

sharp movement into Buttler and Cummins roars out an appeal, but that would have gone down leg. No wicket, but serious skills from Cummins, who is bending the ball whichever way he pleases. Out, out, out, and brings one back in
another in-ducker, keeps a bit low too and homing in on off stump, but Buttler defends from well inside the crease
fullish outside off, driven but a short mid-off is in place and fields
length on off, nipping away a touch, squirted through point
length outside off, left alone
digs it in short, Buttler's instinct seemed to be to go for it, but he drops his hands and sways out of the way
shaping away this time but well outside off and left alone easily
fuller on off, defended solidly to cover
length ball on off, jabbed towards midwicket
good length on off, solid in his forward defense
bouncer, but going down leg, he ducks underneath it safely
length on off, and Overton confidently forward to defend

and the one that comes back in has done it! But Overton wants to review the lbw. Oooh this might be close thing on whether there was bat or not! Skilful bowling by Cummins, who had bowled fullish on off till now and got Overton defending confidently. This one was a bit shorter, and moved in sharply. The issues is the bat is hitting pad at the same time that the ball is going past, and all three are close together. But that doesn't matter because impact was outside off!. Overton survives. Huge cheers around the ground.
another length ball coming in, and this time he stays in his crease and nonchalantly flicks it down to fine leg
fullish on middle and leg, punched towards midwicket
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
bouncer, but too short and he had enough time to see it, so ducks comfortably under it
fuller outside off and that is a peachy looking punch-drive through extra cover that finds the boundary
strays down leg and he misses the tickle. Good take by Paine, diving to his left and he appeals thinking he may have got an edge, but there was no bat there
fuller outside off, defended into the leg side on the front foot
fuller outside off, driven to point
back of a length outside off, left alone
fluent drive to a full one outside off, but straight to short cover
low full toss outside off and Buttler opens the face to glide this past point and into the boundary. Confident, crisp shot
no, he keeps it going across on a length and Buttler leaves it alone
and length ball going across him outside off again, left alone again
spun and kept low, but was a bit short so Overton saw it and went right back, whipped it off his pads
tossed up outside off, drawing him on the front foot to defend
good length outside off, goes off the pad to short leg.
fuller, comes on the front foot to work this towards midwicket
sharp turn from outside off, he stays on the back foot and jabs it on the legs side at the last moment
there's certainly a lot of turn for Lyon, this one spins in from outside off and hits the thigh pad
oooh that was a tight leave. Starc had been going across Buttler but keeps this much straighter, and kissing the fourth stump. Holds its line as it goes through
yorker length on off, driven off the toe-end to mid-off
bouncer in line with the batsman, Buttler ducks under it
shaping away a bit and very full, mis-times his cover drive
length ball, going across him in the channel again. Lets it through
full on the stumps, defended to cover
well outside off, wide enough to be left alone even though it's spinning sharply
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to work this towards mid-on
good length, drawing him on the front foot to defend outside off
slightly shorter, he goes across and hangs back, turns it off his pads to leg slip's left
length ball, goes right back and nudges it to the legside
too short, sat up to be smacked and he does that through midwicket
slightly shorter, spins away from off, lets it go

loud appeal but not given. And they don't review. This might have been worth a review. Nice dip on the ball and Overton is going forward to defend, spins past his attempted nudge and strikes him on the pad. good call to not review, it was bouncing over the stumps
shorter, he goes right back and gets low to pull to midwicket
fuller on off, defended on the front foot to point
length ball outside off, lets it go as it spins away and that will be tea time
Australia celebrate for a catch at short leg but Dharmasena shakes his head and there's no review...straight off the chest guard. Plenty of bounce
presses forward, this flies wide of silly point...it could have glanced the face of the bat on the way out
worked to the leg side
fuller, outside off, he leans forward and defends
plays back and works a straight delivery to midwicket
loops off the pad to leg slip as he plays forward
length ball at off stump, shape back in at Buttler who defends from the crease
fuller, swings in to the stumps, defended on the front foot
a short ball outside off, Buttler sways out of the line
fired well down the leg side...century for Buttler, of balls faced
that's a good one, short of a length with good bounce, Buttler just about holds the bat inside the line as he shapes back again
fuller, edged! Flies wide of the two slips down to third man...Buttler coming slightly across the ball. Hazlewood with hands on head
plays back and this scoots through low from short of a length, watches it closely and works to midwicket
defended from off stump to the on side
full outside off, left alone
a touch slower, full outside off, plays forward and defends
hits the footmarks outside off, Overton defends on the back foot
worked off the pads and Warner dives at leg slip
good length outside off, he's getting this old ball to move, tails back in at Buttler as he leaves it alone
and now he makes it go the other way off the seam, it moves miles! His the seam around off stump and jags away
good length outside off, left alone
a bouncer outside off, Buttler drops his hands and it bounces in front of Paine
short of a length at off stump, 85mph/136kph, defended to the covers
back of a length, straight, worked to midwicket
straights a touch too straight and spins down the leg side
full outside off, pushes forward
a shorter delivery, whipped into midwicket
finds a gap this time as he works this off the pads to deep square leg
sharp spin from outside off, but he rides it well and tucks around the corner
and again, spins into his hip and flicked to backward square leg
short of a length at the body, pulled wide of leg gully

left alone and it's hit off stump! That's the moment for Australia. Hazlewood has made this old ball hoop and this one bends in from outside off, Buttler leaves it alone and pays the price. Memories of Jones to Clarke on this ground in 2005. Brilliant form Hazlewood, ends a superb innings from Buttler
full and straight, targetting the timber, defended

almost kicks this into the stumps! More big inswing, deflects down by Archer's feet and he notices it's dribble towards the stumps and goes to flick it away, flicks it into his other foot and nearly onto the stumps
short outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot and it runs off the face into gully
sharp spin and bounce! Almost goes to leg slip as it goes off the glove onto his thigh pad
full at off stump, inching forward and gets an inside edge into his pad which doesn't carry to short leg
nearly carries to that man just brought in around the corner as he presses forward and gets a think inside edge
defended towards silly point
scoots through low and it's gone! Not much Archer could do about that one, back of a length in the footmarks, grubs through and he's on the back foot. Might have gone under the stumps
round the wicket, full at off stump, gets forward and defends to silly point

huge appeal for lbw against a fantastic yorker which then escapes down to fine leg, it's given runs but Australia review. Was it pad first? A booming inswinging yorker...it misses the front foot, hits the back leg. No bat involved. The ball hasn't got far to travel when it hits the back leg...but it's missing leg stump (although not 100% convinced by the tracking). It's changed to four leg byes
another full delivery with late, takes an outside edge along the ground to second slip
good length outside off, 83mph, swings in again but is solidly defended this time...a spell of utmost class from Hazlewood
works a full delivery off the stumps behind square on the leg side
full outside off, pushed across the left hander and Leach reaches at it away from his body
short of a length into Leach who tucks it very neatly through midwicket, takes three to keep the strike to huge cheers
cuts him in half with a back-of-a-length delivery which nips back sharply
short of a length outside off, skims past the edge again
beaten again, pushing at a length delivery without much footwork
full outside off, some swing, nicely driven to mid-off
banged in a short of a length, defended solidly on the back foot
goes for the yorker! It shapes in late but Leach is equal to it, jabs towards mid-on and even steals the strike
round the wicket, flicked off the pads to leg slip
defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, defended to mid-on
defended wide of silly point
touch more outside off, takes the outside edge but rolls to second slip
shorter outside off, Leach flirts at it but the ball spins to beat him
round the wicket, full at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
full at off stump, defended to mid-off
a shorter delivery, defended on the back foot
short outside off, Overton holds the bat inside the line and lets it go through
full and straight, runs off the outside edge down to third man
short of a length, into the pads, deflects wide of short leg
length ball into him, defended from the crease
length coming into him, tucked to midwicket
oooh, movement away from the left hander. Pitches outside off and moves sharply, Leach lets it through
strays down leg and Leach doesn't play at that
full on the stumps, punched back firmly, but mid-on gathers
peach to end the over, goes through Leach and Paine has to dive to his right to gather. Leach left a gap between bat and and pad, and it went through that
length ball on leg stump, tucked off his pads to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, stays still and watches it go through
goes straighter this time, slightly back of a length, but Leach manages to jab it into the legside
sharp bouncer that goes right past Leach's helmet. Had it been a bit straighter, the batsman would have been in big trouble, but it was just outside off and Leach could drop his gloves in time
too full and Leach shows that the previous ball hasn't fazed him in the slightest. Confidently clips it off his pads to find the square leg boundary
fullish but well outside off, easily left alone. England will be happy to stare at those thud into the keeper's gloves all day - or what's remaining of it
squirted off the outside edge towards gully, who dives to his right to field
length ball on off, defended towards gully
good length in the corridor, confident leave from Overton
bouncer, but going down leg and he ducks under it
past the outside edge. Great length, he's got him reaching for it with a forward defensive push, and the ball follows the angle to go past.
fuller on the stumps, defended to cover
yorker outside off, dug out to point
length ball going across him, outside off, he's not touching that
too straight from that angle and Leach tucks it nicely off his pads to fine leg. He's looked completely calm in a situation that's fraught
fullish outside off, comes on the front foot and defends solidly
length ball on off, comes forward to defend, it moves away a touch and takes the outside edge to trickle to point
fuller outside off, blocked again
bouncer, but the angle from around the wicket takes it down legside
bouncer hits his helmet. On target this time, a nasty rising delivery that crashes into the grille. Not sure if he got a glove on it, but it bounces into a vacant spot near silly point
another bouncer, and this time he ducks under it quickly
another bouncer! boos ring out around the ground. But comfortably played again by Leach, who ducks under it
length ball on the stumps, he stays slightly back but tucks it to midwicket with soft hands
yorker on the stumps, defended solidly to midwicket
drifts down and straigthens to hit him on the pad, but pitched outside leg
length outside off, defended on the front foot towards gully
fuller, drawing him on the front foot, he does it with a big stride to smother the spin
fuller again and defended confidently again with a big lunge forward
very full, low full toss almost, and pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
gets some drift across and raps him on the pad again but from the round the wicket angle that is never going to be a serious lbw candidate
pings him on the shoulder. Short ball and he ducks into it. Didn't rise so high, and ends up hitting him on the left shoulder
another short ball, but going over leg, and he ducks under it
third successive short ball, but too short and he can duck under this more easily
he does, almost. But he's also over-stepped. Length ball outside off, nipping in, and flies past the forward prod of Overton
back to the short stuff it is, and back to ducking under it for Overton
back of a length outside off, defended from the crease, with the weight on the back foot
back of a length, straightening a touch but he's in control of the dead-bat defense
fuller outside off, defended on the front foot
beauty gets it on the perfect length to dip and rip past the batsman's outside edge
too full and comes on the front foot defend
length on the stumps, defended with soft hands on the front foot
length outside off, big lunge forward to push it towards gully
too short and Leach is tempted into going for the cut. Fortunately for him, doesn't connect
starts off with a short ball, and Overton crouches low to let it sail over
length ball on the stumps, gets nicely behind it and defends
back of a length on the stumps, gets behind it and punches from the crease
length ball in the corridor, he covers his stumps and shoulders arms
back of a length, moving away across him, he yanks his bat out of the way as it goes past
back of a length, stump to stump, but a straightforward defensive punch
length ball, takes the pad to short leg
getting some sharp turn from the rough outisde the left handers's off stump, but he defends it
straighter that time, whips it off his pads, but without timing
tossed up fuller, defended on the front foot

caught by short leg! What a move by Paine to bring on the leggie! Ripped one into the rough on a length outside off, and it rears up at Leach, who fends it off from near his stomach, but it takes his gloves and pops up to the fielder stationed there. End of a great resistance by Leach
tossed up way too much, full toss, Broad pats it back down the pitch
fuller on the stumps, worked to midwicket
length on the stumps and that's a century of balls faced for Overton. Defended
length outside off, spinning in, goes right back and taps it towards leg slip
too short and spinning past, helps it along to fine leg. Starc is jogging casually after it but Overton and Broad decide they'll only take a single
length outside off, holds its line, Broad comes forward to defend with bat close to pad, lets it go past
length outside off, confident stride out to defend it into the offside. Massive cheers greet that shot
length ball coming in a touch, defended from the crease
short ball again, doesn't rise much and pings him just above the waist. He was ducking into it and realised too late it wasn't rising high enough

rapped on the pads and the finger goes up! Of course Overton will review, but I think he's a goner here. Length ball, nipping back in, don't think he read that, and it hits him on the knee roll, in front of the stumps. And it's three reds. Australia will retain the Ashes. It was a fantastic fight by Overton, and England, but Australia relentlessly kept at it and broke through in the last hour. What a match. What a finish.
